Reviews.Title: Good phone for the price, but beware the unlock method
Reviews.Author: Nathan Keir Edel "nkedel"
Reviews.Content: I received my phone today, and was quite pleased; nicely light/small and fairly responsive Android despite the low specs, very good deal for the price.  Was able to verify that it was in fact unlocked with a non-AT&T; SIM.  Added bonus: this phone is upgradeable to Gingerbread (Android 2.3.6), with the upgrade being a free download from Pantech.Here's where it gets a little annoying: the upgrade re-locked my new phone!  I was able to find an unlock code online (at a very small cost and a few minutes of my time) but it was an unwelcome surprise.  This phone is still a great deal (cheaper, even with the unlock code added, than a new locked one would have been) but it was an annoyance and someone less technical might have found it a serious problem.  Just be aware of this, if you are considering this phone and want to use the Gingerbread upgrade.--Edited 11/6/2012:  Used this phone on a 2 1/2 week international trip, and was very pleased at how the phone handled a number of different SIMs in different countries, in most cases making 3G connections, and proving usable on 2.5G/EDGE in the one case where it was not.  Really a pretty nifty little phone.My one complaint, and it's not a big one, is that unlike some other phones it could not automatically detect the data APN ("Access Point Name", needed for data service) from the SIM card/network.  This is never a big problem, and in general you can get the answer for the setting needed from the same people who sell SIM cards abroad -- but it's a nice feature to pick up automatically, that most newer phones have.  Definitely worth looking up for the bands of SIM if you're planning to use this as a travel phone, or off AT&T; (I assume it will pick it up correctly on AT&T.;)--Edited 1/4/2012: I wiped the phone to loan it to a friend, and we discovered that the "Factory Restore" wipe also gets rid of the unlock.  I had the code which I purchased elsewhere, but for those buying this for unlocked use, this is another minor point to watch out for (or to watch out for if you later resell the phone.)

Reviews.Title: great phone at a great price
Reviews.Author: Oldtimer
Reviews.Content: My son wanted a slider phone with a qwerty keyboard for texting, and this one turned out to be great (as was the price).  He had previously used a Gravity phone, and it was fine, but it started flaking out after getting wet, so we ordered a Gravity 2, and it was a disaster -- pressing keys would often give either no response or a double response.  So we returned it and ordered this one. Very glad we did! Texting on this keyboard is great.  Unfortunately, it is becoming increasingly difficult to find phones with a proper qwerty keyboard instead of just a display type keyboard, so if you're interested in this type, the Pantech Crossover may be perfect for you, as it is for my son.

Reviews.Title: Little Powerhouse!
Reviews.Author: J_88
Reviews.Content: I received the phone and have been using it for a little over a week now.Let me go through a very informal review.Right off the bat you will notice that this phone is made of quality materials. The touch screen is perfect for the size of the phone and very responsive. The keyboard is very easy to use and easy to slide out on the go. Also I can verify that the phone is completely unlocked and very easy to use with any gsm providor that you choose. It only took me about 10 minutes to put the sim card in and call the service provider and within no time I was talking and texting.The camera on the phone isn't the greatest and has a hard time taking pictures in dark rooms, however, in a brightly lit room and in the daylite this phone takes surprisingly great pictures! I was surprised that some of the pictures that I took rivaled my 1080p digital camera.The webbrowser for this phone is EXCELLENT and the phone seamlessly connects to wifi signals. The phone has a great interface and I called the phone a little powerhouse because it is very fast.A side note: The phone comes with Android 2.2 Froyo which is excellent because you will experience no problems and have a very fast device. However if you feel like you would like to have the latest technology the phone is upgradeable for free to Android 2.3 gingerbread. IF YOU UPGRADE YOUR PHONE IT WILL RELOCK IT! I was able to pay a small fee from a website and the phone was once again unlocked. Android 2.3 makes the phone EVEN FASTER, and integrates some improvements to the voice command service.This is my first Smartphone and it is an excellent buy! 5/5 stars you will love it!

Reviews.Title: Cute little powerhouse
Reviews.Author: larsona
Reviews.Content: Let me be honest: I wasn't expecting much.My previous experience with Android would be the Kindle fire, or 4.0. I didn't really think that it would be good compared to my Windows Phone (Which I loved!). I knew that if you go into the history of Android, it's full of errors. The OS would be unstable. I would have to reboot (or pull out the battery). It would just be a nightmare.But after seeing all the other reviews, I made the decision to risk it. After more than three months of saving (I'm fourteen), I finally had the funds to cover both the product and the shipping (Which was stupid, because it would have been prime a few days later). I ordered it.The whole reason I needed a new phone was because the earpiece on mine no longer worked, and I ordered a mount on Amazon for my bike that ended up making my phone do a swan-dive to the pavement. So, I started calling the screen repair places... they basically give me the hint that my phone was totaled. So, I started looking for other options.After a few long days, I finally received the phone. I understood that it was unlocked and -- pay attention here -- updating the software WOULD re-lock it. Now, this wasn't any problem for me, because I already have AT&T.; It is a VERY good idea to update it to Gingerbread (and I'll tell you why a little bit later on), but beware that it will wipe everything -- including the unlock -- on the phone and put on the new phone software again.Opening the package, there was no SIM card. A good thing, but if this is your first GSM and you are in need of a SIM card this phone is not yours just yet. I needed to put a Micro-SD card in, because that is the memory for the phone. Other than a little bit inside the phone, you'll be fully reliant on that little guy.I turned it on, linked it to my Google Account, and I was off. First impressions? A little bit better than what I expected. It was definitely slow, but it was a little power-house. I liked the swipe! It was really easy to use.I installed a few apps to see what it would be like with the RAM. It was okay, but not the greatest.Then, I went to the Pantech website, and downloaded the package. It's really easy to find. Just Google "Pantech", then click support, then scroll down to "Pantech Crossover" on the left hand side.The process took about seven minutes, and if you have a slow internet connection, I will warn you now that it will take longer. Like I mentioned before, it will wipe all the data on your device. I strongly recommend that you charge it fully, then do the update. I linked it to my Google Account (again), and my first impressions? One word: AWESOME. The performance improved 500%, and even though I noticed that on power on, it takes a while to load your applications, it was a really good experience. Even though the screen seems really small, and I do not recommend the possibility of coming to this phone from a  tablet phone, I strongly recommend this phone to anyone! Experienced with android, or without.

Reviews.Title: x10 BETTER THAN I EXPECTED (READ THIS IF YOU NEED INFO)
Reviews.Author: Chrissy
Reviews.Content: I've been through a lot of different phones being as I'm a 21 year old girl. I'M VERY PICKY. I prefer blackberries. I have to have a keyboard. Touchscreen only doesn't do it for me, I can't get it no matter how much I practice. I do love the features of a touch screen. So, I go for this. Honestly in pictures it looks OK... Once I opened the package, I was surprised! And even better in my hand! I will tell you it is a little heavier than any other phone I've had but you can FEEL the durability. It doesn't feel like some cheap plastic phone. The back goes on and stays on very well also. No glitches at all. Runs very fast and smooth.  I got my package around 5pm yesterday. I changed my battery fully and unplugged as soon as it was done. I've been texting non-stop, had a few phone calls. I've had WIFI running, gone on the web, downloaded apps and even played tetris. It's 7:15 am now and I've used my phone since I got it yesterday, don't ask about my sleep schedule! Lmao....Anyways, my point - THe battery life is AMAZING. I have 73% of my battery left. Not expecting that! IT ALSO CHARGED VERY FAST! I am also an AT&T; GOPHONE customer, I popped in my SimCARd and IT DID WORK. There IS a SIM card slot AND a memory card slot, YES! The sound through the phone calls is great, the camera IS A VERY  good quality! THE ONLY COMPLAINT I HAVE...that does not bother me really but IT MAY bother you, the volume for playing music or ringtones, is a bit lower than a normal phone if you have a song at normal sound...Like say if you get a song from MYXER, you have the option to boost the sound level, DO IT! Because if you don't it'll be pretty low... As for the keyboard, the keys are SOFT buttons...I will admit it's a tiny bit aggravating that the UP arrow button that is right beside the M key...I accidently hit it a lot but Its not one of those things that's unavoidable, once you get used to your fingers going right in place, you shouldn't hit it. Ummm I can't really think of anything else that most people look for in a phone... IF you have any question feel free to ask, I don't check amazon a lot but I will def. try to answer....... But HONESTLY buy this phone from Amazon in case you don't like it bc Amazon has a fair return policy but this is without a doubt the best phone I have ever had and worth the DEAL of 71.99 ! If you want this phone, don't hesitate.

Reviews.Title: Real keyboard, long battery life, all around good phone.
Reviews.Author: Gordon S. Marlowe
Reviews.Content: I've had one of these for about a year and it's been great.  I have 4 other people on my AT&T; plan, and all 5 of us have this phone now.  You can turn off the 3G/4G data network while setting it up and it'll never use AT&T; data network and you'll not have to get a data plan for it.It runs most android apps just fine.My favorite thing about this phone is how tough it is.  Having a smaller screen and being a little thicker, you can put it in your back pocket and sit on it without breaking the screen, which was a serious problem with our previous smart phones.I'm seriously considering ordering one more to have a spare on hand in case one eventually breaks, but so far not one has had a problem.

Reviews.Title: Good phone!
Reviews.Author: MAJK Organization, Inc. "littleblueowl"
Reviews.Content: This phone is very convenient for me. I needed a phone that would get on the net using Wifi only, and didn't have to have a data package. The slide-out keyboard is easy to type on. The icons for the most used services are on the front screen. The on/off button is out of reach for accidentally hitting it. The only problem I have found is that the volume button can, and does, get hit accidentally. This is inconvenient when the phone is ringing, as hitting this button shuts down the ring.

Reviews.Title: Great phone for great price.
Reviews.Author: M. Pugh "Geeky PC Repair Guy"
Reviews.Content: I've noticed my brothers very expensive AT&T; android based phone that's huge, totally touch screen and I'm sure very fancy with many spiffy functions. His phone is like jamming a tablet PC in your pocket. I've had my share of full touch screen phones and when it comes to texting, I hate them. I don't have teeny tiny fingers to use a virtual keyboard and usually the processors are so slow I'm waiting to push the next key. Most folks complain that this phone needs a flash light app, and a flash function for the camera or a bigger screen. They need my brothers phone and a back pack to carry it in. If I want a photo that requires a flash for darker indoor use I'm not going to use a cell phone anyway. I have nice digital camera that does that pretty well. Now it is true I moved up from an LG800 to this phone which is like moving from stone knives and furs to the Imperial Deathstar, so my opinion is based on that. Is this the newest superwamadyne smartest smart phone on the planet? Nope probably not close. But I can say it is rugged, full featured, compact enough to fit in a belt holster and it doesn't feel cheap. These phones sold for $350.00 when they first came out. I got mine for around $70 bucks. I got it quickly, ordered a Straight Talk sim card for it, activated in about 2 minutes and I'm off and running. For a no contract phone service this phone is way ahead of the curve. Oh and I'm playing Angry Birds Star Wars edition on it for free.

Reviews.Title: No miss call /text reminder notifiation
Reviews.Author: JellyBeans
Reviews.Content: There are a lot of detailed reviews on this phone, so I will skip all the tech details.  I mainly want to mention couple of minor features that were not talked about by other reviewers.I am not a heavy cellphone user, nor very savvy when it comes to the latest technology on cell phones, but I know exactly what features I would want my cell phones to have, or I should say, my cell phones MUST HAVE.Couple things I look for on a cell phone: clear talk quality on both speaker and headset, miss call/sms/mms reminder notification. Prior my decision to keep Pantech Crossover, I tried Sony Xperia U and Motorola Flipside, both phones have the miss call/sms/mms reminder notification but lack of clarity when using speaker and headset.  Pantech Crossover got the call clarity, however lack the miss call/sms/mms reminder notification.  The reason I kept Pantech Crossover because I was able to download an app from GooglePlay (free, you will need to have internet connection on your phone, I used WIFI) for the reminder notification.  However, keep in mind, there is no LED light on this phone, so the only reminder notification you will have to use is by vibration or sound or both.Aside from those 2 features, it's a very sold pone, bit bulky due to the sliding keypad.  The response time, both loading an app and touchscreen sensitivity, is slow, but I don't mind, it's Android 2.3 not 4.2.  I was able to upgrade to Gingerbread.  To upgrade to Gingerbread, you will have to download a file from Pantech website (done on your computer), also, I would suggest upgrade to Gingerbread before you set up your phone or download any app, because by upgrading, it will whip out everything on the phone, except the contacts on your SIM.I have ATT, so I don't know if the phone was locked again after the upgrade. Overall, the phone is easy to use, it's a good transition phone from an old fashioned phone to a complete touchscreen phone.----Apps that I have downloaded from GooglePlay, all free:-Silent Toggle Widget - One click to set you phone to ring, vibrate, or silent.  Unlike other phones I had used in the past, Pantech Crossover only has either vibrate or complete silent if press the volume key all the way down-Ringdroid - assigns ringtones and edit your ringtones; your mp3/ringtones have to be on the microSD card-ES Task Manager - closes unused apps to save battery-Missed Message Flasher - reminds me any missed calls or text

Reviews.Title: pantech crossover
Reviews.Author: dwest
Reviews.Content: Product met and exceeded expectations. A really neet phone. Multitasking (internet access, sending text and pic messages all while on the phone). Would recommend to anyone. Already upgraded from android froyo to gingerbread. It was a breeze. The pantech usb driver (free at pantech site) is out of this world when you connect to a pc.

Reviews.Title: sweet phone, glad I updated
Reviews.Author: Gorn's Brother
Reviews.Content: love the slide-out QWERTY since I hate txting on touch screen,  immediately upgraded to android 2.3.6 before installing sim using pantechusa site, it stayed unlocked, popped in a straightalk unlimited plan and bring your own phone AT&T; sim, now I got a fine smartphone for 70, unlimted call,txt, data (well, 2 GB data really) plan for 45/month, less than I paid Verzn for 450 minutes just talk.  the phone rocks, set-up piece of cake .. liking it all so far ... afforable mobile smarts ith no commitment, just the way I like it.

Reviews.Title: If your looking for a reasonably priced smart phone, this is it
Reviews.Author: DiamondDandy
Reviews.Content: The phone is made in Korea, not China.  For me that's a plus, I've had very good luck with products made in Korea.  I can't say the same for China.  The phone is well built, very intuitive and has a flip open qwerty keyboard.  For me, this is great, I've got large fingers.  You can use either the touch or the physical keyboard.  The manual that came with it is terrible.  I downloaded one from the Pantech site and that's really helpful.  If your looking for your first smart phone this is a winner.  Very easy to learn.  The Pantech online site is really user friendly as well.  Pantech allows you to uprgrade the android os for free.  I've owned these phones for a little over a month and we are impressed by the quality, the easy and fast learning curve and Pantech online support.  (I say we,because I bought two of them)OK the phone is great, the outfit I bought them from, cellphone lounge, needs to change the description from "new" to something else.  Both boxes had been opened before I got them, both phones were missing the 2g memory card and both were missing the CD.  They did send me the memory cards right away, but never emailed me or had any communication at all.  I had to call them to find out what was going on.

Reviews.Title: Almost Perfect
Reviews.Author: PawlKat
Reviews.Content: I love the phone. Being pretty computer savvy, but this being my first smart phone, I am finding that it has plenty of bang for the buck.  I bought it to use on Straight Talk, and couldn't be more pleased.My only complaint is that it was sent without the manufacturer's Micro SD card.  I read about this from other reviewers and am assuming that the seller poaches the cards when they unlock them. However, as the phone is being sold as new, I contacted the seller to let them know about the missing card. They responded immediately and offered two choices to rectify the matter- return for full refund, or keep and receive a partial refund (which I chose. )In the end the phone and purchasing an SD card from a local retailer was well within my budget, and feels like I got a great deal for exactly what I wanted.

Reviews.Title: Too many issues...
Reviews.Author: Rich Rich
Reviews.Content: This phone has several flaws...(a) The advertised battery life is false -- instead of 5 hours of talk time, prepare for 3 -- also the standby time of 19 days is more like 3 days.  Maybe Pantech tests their phones in a timeless vacuum...(b) I am unable to find a headset to use with this phone -- I've tried 2 and as soon as you plug the headset in it starts the music player.  I've disconnected the music player and removed the music on the phone and now when I plug in a headset, the phone disconnects the call!  Also, if you want to use ear buds and then talk into the phone (like a walkie talkie) that is impossible as well.(c) Sometimes the phone will freeze up during a text and then you are forced to turn it off or remove the battery.(d) If you want to use a favorite song as a ring tone or as a wake up alarm -- you can't.(e) The phone comes with the setting of "data off" -- so when people start sending you texts with photos, be prepared to not see what they are sending you.  Instead you'll waste time trying to download the image only to get an error message that says unable to download.  This will make you think there is something wrong with your phone.  Instead, wade into the innards and turn the data setting on.(f) The user's manual that came with phone is a joke -- it looks like a beginners reader for kindergärtners.  Don't expect too much from it.(g) Both AT&T; and Google have put a bunch of junk on the phone -- all of it comes started by default,  So you will be wading through all of that to try and make the phone battery last.(h) The Android operating system is kind of a pain in the butt -- it's three steps to accomplish anything.  I can see why people prefer the Apple phone or a basic stick phone.(i) All that said, there are good points to the phone (the keyboard makes texts easier), but if you want to use your phone foremost to make calls and send texts, there are easier devices out there.Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: Youtube Lies
Reviews.Author: R. Southern "overload"
Reviews.Content: PRODUCT:5 stars on the phone this phone works great. Don't let youtube reviews keep you from buying it. They say it's not responsive sometimes i call BS on them. They pull the phone right out of the box no chance to warm up from the cold warehouses it was in. Of courses the phone will not respond well for the 1st 10 to 20 mins. Most touch screens wont. So please remember to give it 20 mins or so to warm up after u turn it on the 1st time just stick it in your pocket.SELLER: 4 stars for stealing the micro SD cards out of the box that comes factoryTIPS: This phone does not come with a feature to have a costume ringtone but dont back out on it there is an app I found called RINGDRIOD that helps with that as long as the song you want is on your micro sd card. Also battery life is great but if you want to keep it that way download ES TASKMANAGER and install the widget so u can tap it once and close all your apps you can also set it up to close apps when screen is off. Also if you are like me and only use it on wifi download an app called APN onoff to turn off the 3g to save you from using data.Features: speaker phone gets 4 stars from me because it does cut out on occasion. Key board 5 stars very responsive. Touch screen 4 stars could get 5 but still feel there could be some improvement on response. Browsing 3 stars could be a quicker for price range but still decent speed. App speed 4 stars good for price range but takes forever to load angry birds. Special Pantech features 5 stars all the new features pantech added are very useful especially the drag and drop on lock screen.Update:I have downloaded the gingerbread OS update for the phone it does make the phone run faster and more responsive and makes the virtual keyboard easier to use i do suggest you download the update because it will make this phone better in my opinion i think it takes this phone from an ok 4 star phone to a strong 4 or 4.5 for the price range

Reviews.Title: Severely disappointed :(
Reviews.Author: Luwho
Reviews.Content: This phone was great for 6 and a half months. My husband loved, loved it. Then out of no where He could not hear anyone and they could not hear him when they call unless he put it on speaker, then it started disconnecting calls randomly and now the speaker phone feature is quitting all within 2 weeks. My return window expired in October so now we are stuck, I would consider a replacement but I do not even have that option. I usually like Pantech product but this one was seriously disappointing. This is a ridiculously short life for a phone, especially one that was owned by a 50 year old tech phobic guy and not one of my teenagers. This is the first time in four years that I have been this disappointed with something I purchased from Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Just What I Wanted
Reviews.Author: beckaroony
Reviews.Content: This is my first Android phone.  So far so good!  Good price for a phone with Android, a slide out keyboard, GPS, & Wi-Fi.A previous reviewer mentioned his phone re-locked after updating the O.S.  This was true for me also.  I went online to find out how to get a new unlock code.  I came across this forum:  [...]  It mentioned that AT&T; will give a free unlock code if you call their customer service [...] and tell them you just purchased an AT&T; phone and need it unlocked.  I followed the instructions and before I knew it, I had a free unlock code!  The phone has worked fine after that.If you're looking for a semi-basic Android phone, this one will not disappoint you.

Reviews.Title: 5 Stars
Reviews.Author: Ray
Reviews.Content: This is a Great Phone all the way around! built very good' and has the 2.2 Android Version' Clear Screen with allso the slideout Keypad' you can not go wrong with this phone! Love It

Reviews.Title: Awesome phone!
Reviews.Author: Stephanie
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone for my husband who wanted a small phone where he could call, do some texting, do some web searching, and he wanted a good battery life.  This phone definitely met the criteria. He has had the phone for 2 months and loves it.  The battery life is great.  He can let the phone sit for days and it still has power.  The phone easily slips into his pocket and doesn't weigh down his pants.  The sound quality is very good.  He has not complained about not being able to hear the person on the other side. He can text easily because of the query key board which is perfect for his big fingers that makes texting on a touch screen very difficult for him.  The phone is solid and very easy to use.  I did have to buy a memory card for the camera to work, but the card was not very expensive. The camera doesn't have a flash.  However, the pictures have still been fine for us.  The flashlight app does work on this phone.  Instead of a beam where the camera flash would be, the screen is brightly illuminated when using the app. I would highly recommend this phone to someone who wants an easy to use, small phone.

Reviews.Title: great phone, except volume when listening to calls was too low
Reviews.Author: Ms. Lady
Reviews.Content: Pros: I liked this phone--it was well made, had all the features I liked, was easy to use, all the apps I used worked well. Battery life was very adequate.  Pantech technical support was very helpful and courteous. Similarly, AT&T; was helpful.Cons: The problem was when I made a phone call, the volume was too low for me to comfortably use.  Unfortunately, I returned it because I could not hear well enough to use it as a phone.  A second problem was that although the screen (3.1") was large enough to see most things, text messages required me to use a magnifying glass.There is an error in the online manual, which said it used a micro sim card; it used a mini sim card.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for the clumsy-fingered smartphone user!
Reviews.Author: QuintBy
Reviews.Content: I purchased this phone in particular 1) because it offered Android capabilities with a slider keyboard and 2) because I had read that this phone in particular would be detected as a feature phone instead of a smartphone provided that data was shut off prior to activating it. The keyboard has proved even better than I had hoped, offering quick and easy access to numbers and symbols as well to all-caps use. As for avoiding a mandatory AT&T; data plan, so far so good. It is quite capable of making use of my home wireless signal.I continue to keep my eye open to make certain that data does not accidentally get switched on as I have little use for it away from home. It's a weighty little guy, which I personally prefer.Accustomed as I am am to a Comcast download speed of about 25 mbits/sec, web browsing is a little slow but I expected that. For the price I don't think you're likely to find anything better as of the date of this review.

Reviews.Title: Stopped working in 30 days
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Shakir
Reviews.Content: The phone stopped working at exactly the end of the return policy period.  Stuck.  I have had trouble with other Pantech phones as well.

Reviews.Title: Great Basic Text + WiFi Phone
Reviews.Author: Dan R. Wojciechowski
Reviews.Content: I got the Pantech P8000 for my son even without a data plan.  It's his first "smart" phone, and he loves it.  Between home and school, he always has WiFi access, so the lack of a data plan doesn't hinder him.

Reviews.Title: PANTECH A GOOD PHONE
Reviews.Author: Bobby
Reviews.Content: Have had no problem with this phone,i will buy it again.For someone that just want a phone and has no need to have the internet 24/7.It is not new version but it gets the job done. It was easy to pair with my bluetooth headset.If you need the internet 24/7 than this is not the phone,but if you need a good phone to talk and email,then youcant

Reviews.Title: Fantastic phone for the price
Reviews.Author: Phillip A Harvey
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone several months ago when my wife's Samsung Gravity suddenly died. She needed a QWERTY keyboard, so at $70 this phone was the most affordable I could find. I wasn't expecting much, so I was pleasantly surprised at the quality of this phone. It worked immediately when I put the SIM card from her old phone in. Even though it is small, the screen resolution is sharp. The keyboard is easy to use. The on-screen keyboard is rather small, but the SWYPE feature is far more accurate than on the Samsung phone. The 512mb of internal storage lets you download a multitude of apps. I haven't found one yet that doesn't work on this phone. The camera is auto-focus, not fixed, so it will read bar and QR codes. It has a lot of AT&T; apps preloaded, some didn't work with T-Mobile but I was able to download similar ones from Google Play. I like this phone so much that I ordered one for myself.UPDATE 1/18/14: I'm finding a few apps not compatible with this phone (notably Candy Crush Saga) Keep an app killer handy as it does tend to bog down when running several apps. Now that I am on Straight Talk with an AT&T; sim, I was able to upgrade to Android Gingerbread without the phone locking up. After nearly a year with this phone, I would still recommend it. Mine has been used, abused, dropped, etc. and is still going strong.

Reviews.Title: Excellent for the price. I use it for free with no service plan
Reviews.Author: Annie
Reviews.Content: I was thinking about adding a 2nd phone to my T-mobile account for my daughter. She is only 8 and doesn't really use a phone yet but likes to play the games, has a few friends starting to call etc. I bought this phone for her and as a back up for my own higher end smart phone. ( I have an HTC Amaze)  I like this. It's on the smaller side, I like the key pad. The Wifi works without needing a SIM card- so guess what? I didn't need to add cell service. My daughter downloaded all the games and apps she wanted from marketplace and because I already have a skype account and phone# I just added it to this phone... so as long as there is a Wifi connection, this phone does all I need it to with no sim or service plan!! I added a wifi texting app too...  Skype works works just as well as my cellular phone. The Wifi on this is faster and better than my high end Amaze and the sound is better too. I loaded pandora, my amazon cloud, my music...  The camera is only 3 mp- but for my kid's cell phone, this thing is the bomb!! Huge upgrade from my old G1...  If you want a basic android smart phone and don't need all the bells and whistles, this has most anyway...  and it's so easy to use. I am giving this 5 stars because I bought this used but like new condition on amazon and I was VERY impressed for the phone I received for the price... I can't imagine you can find a better android for this price!

Reviews.Title: Bad Phone
Reviews.Author: J. Durham "muskogee Okie"
Reviews.Content: My wife and I each have this phone. We bought them about 6 months ago from Amazon. The phone is very hard to use. It is difficult for me and my wife to find our photos, delete messages ect. The menus are very unfriendly.  The kicker happened about 3 weeks ago. Both phones turn off on their own and the only way to to turn the phone back on is to remove the battery wait 10 or 15 seconds put the battery back in then turn the phone on.  Many times the phones refuse to recharge the battery.  Again the battery must be removed and reinserted then the phone will charge.  The call quality is good and also the single strength. This is why i gave a 2 star rating. But the other issues make this a phone that is very frustrating and not recommend.

Reviews.Title: Great phone
Reviews.Author: Chief Jo
Reviews.Content: Got this phone for my wife and I've been playing with it since it came in.  Phone works great and I like the keyboard.  I would have given it 5 stars but for the hassle of updating it to gingerbread.  Tried first on my pc and the updating program would not launch on it.  My pc would sync with the phone great, but software would not launch.  So moved to my sons pc, on that one the software would launch, but the phone wouldn't sync with the pc.  After trying for a couple hours on those 2 pcs, I then tried it on one of our laptops, finally worked.  I bought the unlock code for it ahead of time since I read in other reviews it relocks the phone, and it did.  Other than having to spend another 12 bucks to unlock it, the unlock went smooth and now it's 2.3.6.  It does seem a little faster and more responsive after applying the update.  Too bad they don't do the update, then unlock them and offer them for sale then.

Reviews.Title: good phone the price
Reviews.Author: visualizor
Reviews.Content: I bought the unlock version of this phone for a little above 71 dollars. I'm on T-mobile and it works fine. Since the phone is originally a contract phone for att, there are several integrated features that are based on att, although that doesn't affect me very much. those are the features i rarely use even if i am on att. This is about the cheapest smart phones i could find. it runs on android. it doesn't have the smooth fluency in operation as on devices such as samsung galaxy but it is quite powerful as this pantech has built in integrations with many of the social network apps. the full featured key pad helps a lot in freeing up the small screen, although on screen keyboard is available when your in portrait view. with a few more bucks you can get a micro SD card which is a must for this. without it, you can even take pictures or listen to music. some of the other downside is the buttons on the side. they do get in the way sometimes when you slide it open. because the power button is on the corner where you usually press your index finger to slide open the phone, you can get the phone screen locked when you try to use the keypad. that shouldnt be a big problem once you get used to it. Since it is the cheapest smartphone unlocked out there and the major smartphone functions on this one works well, it is a worthwhile gadget overall.

Reviews.Title: Easy to learn intro into Droid technology.
Reviews.Author: Greg Selfe
Reviews.Content: Got this as an upgrade phone for the AT&T; go phone service. Works great even with the basic and data plans instead of the smart phone plan. Only drawback is you can only access internet with wi-fi access instead of being able to use 3G, minor setback and hasn't been much of a pain. I'm just trying to save a few bucks from the expensive smart phone plans.

Reviews.Title: New Pantech Crossover P8000 has died
Reviews.Author: Rita
Reviews.Content: After four months this phone has stopped working properly. The battery dies before a 24-hour period has passed. I have NO applications running and my Wi-Fi is turned OFF.  I purchased a new battery (with warranty) and the problem is the same. Time to call the Pantech Support Line for possible replacement.  AT&T; rep told me Pantech phones have battery "burnout," problems.

Reviews.Title: Works well with AT&T.;
Reviews.Author: Candy Cane
Reviews.Content: We purchased the Sharp phone that is very similar.  It broke immediately.  So this one has been a great relief.  It works great.  I don't know about other phone plans, but it worked seamlessly with the AT&T; SIM card.

Reviews.Title: My 16 year old son wants it now
Reviews.Author: Deborah K. Brown "ladystlouis"
Reviews.Content: I like this phone a lot.  when I first got it my 16 year old son started playing around with it and it took him awhile to give it to me! lol  I really like being able to use the keyboard to txt I'm just not fond of the smart phone screen for texting. I'm really not using this phone for apps or data to much so It works for me.  I like that the battery lasts and I only have to charge every 2 or 3 days.

Reviews.Title: Great Until it Died
Reviews.Author: L. Brown
Reviews.Content: This phone was great in every respect until it suddenly died last week, necessitating an emergency run to the store to get my daughter a replacement phone.  Approximately three months of life for a phone is not enough. Stay away from this one.

Reviews.Title: Great little phone
Reviews.Author: TO Scootz
Reviews.Content: I picked this phone based on the positive reviews it has received, and I haven't been disappointed. It seems well made, the keyboard works well, the display is clear, and it's been a great introduction to smart phones.  I originally bought it to use in Europe if I needed to get in touch with my 91 year old mother. I figured I could pick up a prepaid SIM card, and get in touch with her quickly, if needed. Since I bought it I've contacted my cell carrier (I had a older flip phone), they gave me a free SIM card and switched the Pantech over to be my new phone.....cool!  I've loaded in a MP3 music program, and connected the phone to my bluetooth motorcycle intercom, for music while I ride, works well and has great battery life, and I also downloaded a free trial N.A. GPS program (I have a identical paid program for Western Europe on my tablet that I was wanting to get a feel for) and it performed quite well, despite the smallish screen. (for a GPS)All in all I'm very happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: READ THIS IF YOU WANT INFO
Reviews.Author: EarthDay
Reviews.Content: I recieved my pantech crossover today and so far am very pleased!! The touchscreen runs very smoothly and there are other capapbilities to make this phone quick and easy!! Its a very durable and sturdy little phones. The camera is also very strong and the amount of storage is very large at first!! The extra applications are very helpful shortcuts and calling and texting is a snap with the easy access front screen shortcuts!! Also the ringtones and text tones are very cool and there are many features to unlock the phone!! You can have a PIN code, a pattern code.or a regular password.But i read somewhere dont upgrade it, because it automatically relocks. Other than that this is a perfect phone!! the screen formats are very similar to the iphone format!! Please consider this phone!!

Reviews.Title: Great phone...except for the battery
Reviews.Author: Missy
Reviews.Content: The phone is awesome, everything I was looking for in a smartphone easy to use, nice graphics, great features. But the battery life is awful! I have gotten 2 and both batteries were awful! You can have the phone on for maybe 5 hours without even using the phone and it will need charged. Nice phone but awful battery life.

Reviews.Title: Great phone for the price
Reviews.Author: Brian
Reviews.Content: This phone is a great purchase for anyone looking for a phone to get started with in the android smart phone world. However, i do find the buttons at the top of the phone a bit sensitive at times, and the phone can be slow from time to time as well.My general thoughts are this phone is worth the money, especially for a teen. The phone seems to be quite durable. I dropped it on a concrete driveway, it bounced a few times ... i thought my phone for sure had a crack in the screen or even a chip. Nothing.It does come unlocked. You can upgrade the phones android system, but it will lock the phone again.

Reviews.Title: Nice Phone
Reviews.Author: Steven
Reviews.Content: Its really a pity that this phone appears to be no longer available for purchase, as it would make a good first smartphone for some of the older people out there (I'm 62).Battery life is decent, given what it does. It connected readily to my Netgear WiFi router, so I save a small fortune in accessing new apps.Call quality is good, also paired readily with my Bluetooth headset. Cam pre-loaded with Gingerbread.  Not the latest Android version. but still good. Don't know if you can upgrade to a newer version of Android. Haven't really looked. But I suspect it would require Root access.Can't say much about the music player though. Volume was almost non-existant, but that was improved somewhat by a free app I found on Google play. But still, music sounds rather flat without a real equalizer. Frankly, my old LG Encore has better sound.What I'd like to see is Pantech upgrade the components and bring out an improved version.All in all, not bad for a 2 year old phone.

Reviews.Title: Problems after 2 weeks use
Reviews.Author: Dallas viewer
Reviews.Content: Nice unit came as adverized unlocked . Inserted Consumer Cellular sim and instant access.Directions for use from AT&T; a bit flaky and not exactly clear but a minor inconvenienceUPDATENot a very pleasant experience . Phone would not shut off . Could not reset apps or initial screen format.Returned it through Amazon without a problem .

Reviews.Title: I love this phone!
Reviews.Author: C Scott Duckworth
Reviews.Content: I got this phone about 2 weeks ago. It is my first smartphone, actually my first mobile phone ever to be honest. The build quality is really nice, when the keyboard slides out it doesn't feel like it's going to fall off. The keys have a nice feel to them. I upgraded the firmware to Gingerbread 2.3.6 and everything runs really well. Android is a lot of fun to tweak and tinker with and there's so many things you can do... It's basically like having a portable PC in your pocket, which also just happens to have the capability of making calls. Although the 600mhz processor isn't very powerful, this phone can handle all the basics, and can even play games with simple graphics. Overall, I love it !!!!

Reviews.Title: Love, Love,  Love
Reviews.Author: Maxine McGinnis
Reviews.Content: It took me about 30 minutes to figure out how to use the phone. Now I am a happy customer.

Reviews.Title: Good Phone. Just a little outdated.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I like the phone a lot, but it's OS is very outdated. VERY. It also lags doing the simplest of tasks. Keep that in mind. Good for the price, though.

Reviews.Title: Great solid phone for my teen
Reviews.Author: James Jacobs
Reviews.Content: Honestly can't complain about anything considering the price.  Solid phone for the texting teenager.  Uses AT&T; network, so any MVNO that uses the AT&T; network (like Straightalk) will work.

Reviews.Title: Phone started having problems right away.
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey L. Huesties "jeffh1976"
Reviews.Content: The phone speaker broke just a few weeks after getting it. Now I can only talk with speaker phone. Other than that, the phone is ok.

Reviews.Title: solid good all around
Reviews.Author: M-Powered Innovations "MPI"
Reviews.Content: this may seem like a rather bland review, but honesty is always the best.  basically, this is a basic smart phone by android--at least in comparison to the galaxies of the world.  this doesnt have the size or bells and whistles of the expensive android cousins, but this is a solid entry choice, especially if you like a keypad to type with, which was a must for me, as the software keypads never work well for me.  i would rate this 4.5 stars, so i rounded down, b/c it could have been a little better.  i dont regret getting this, esp for $70 and NO contract, and i am tempted to bump it to 5 stars just for this reason.  but taken altogether, i cant give this a perfect score b/c it just seems to be lacking that final "umph" to push it over the top.  i even upgraded to android 2.3 and i actually think it ran better out of the box with 2.2.  had the SD card been a little more accessible without having to pop out the battery, and the keys placed slightly differently, and a lot of minor stuff like this, this would be a 5-star easily.  4.5 is solid, and one of the best bangs for the buck for a smart phone with stand alone keypad.  i highly recommend the phone if these are your criteria, i am not disappointed in the purchase, but still feels its a little short of a perfect score, if i were to pick nits :).

Reviews.Title: Great phone.
Reviews.Author: Eric M
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone cause I wanted a good QWERTY keyboard, but didn't wanted to spend a lot, so I gave this phone a chance.I'm actually very pleased with it.Pros.-Good QWERTY keyboard; Not as good as other phones, but still very good for the price.-Capacitive touchscreen; 3.1" screen, still very good to touch, very responsive.-Android 2.2; even doe there are phones with much greater android versions, still very good.-Function button; might not be the best, but I found it very useful.Cons.-Can't use your own ringtones, you have to use the ones that comes with the phone.-3 megapixel camera; Takes average photos with good light, with out it, just not good.-Speaker; Just has one speaker at the back, if you're in a place with constant noise, you won't hear a thing.-Signal strength; sometimes the signal bars indicates that the phone has a strength one, but it's not possible to make even a call, says there's no mobile network available, the only way I've found to make the phone functional again, is rebooting it.Hope you find this review useful.I'm very happy with this phone, because of the price more than anything else, still a very nice phone.

Reviews.Title: Pantech Cross-Over
Reviews.Author: Carmen
Reviews.Content: Pros: Large Screen; easy to use; no need for data contract; wi-fi; nice phone for the money if you can put up with the 'sometimes' cons.Cons: 'Sometimes': Turns off by itself; locks up and you have to take out the battery to get it going again; hit wrong buttons when picking it up. In addition: ring tone is not loud enough; need to buy SD card if you want to take photos (didn't come with one).  Nonetheless, it's better than my previous phone.

Reviews.Title: I had to return it
Reviews.Author: B. Mines
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone and while in transition I was given a phone so by the time this reached me, it wasn't needed anymore. It looked pretty cool too. I talked to the sender's and they had no problem accepting my return that made it an easy return. No hassle just quick and simple service.

Reviews.Title: good for no contract
Reviews.Author: Aaron Taylor
Reviews.Content: decently priced and used with tmobile no contract....a few bugs maybe but could be user error...not familiar with the 'smart world'

Reviews.Title: This phone was for a relative.
Reviews.Author: ebonae
Reviews.Content: They liked the phone. It was their first android phone, and they liked the fact that it was a slider phone.

Reviews.Title: Great Seller and fast ship!
Reviews.Author: patricia mcleod
Reviews.Content: Have tmobile and this phone works great with the sim card!  it picks up reception in many remote places that we live in that tmobile is unable to which astounds me!  The qwerty keyboard is perfect as my previous one used to be smaller on the buttons, really smaller.  This is shorter than the ipod 5th generation.  it fits well in the pocket.  It has great features and the touch board is awesome and smooth!  Thanks!

Reviews.Title: Grows on you.
Reviews.Author: Mosin Nagant
Reviews.Content: I haven't purchased a phone w/contract for some time. This one does what I want it to which is work "offline" and play music. This one does limit the size of ringtones so I wasn't able to turn songs directly into ringtones without shortening the length. I like the ability to easily turn data on and off and setting up basically an unlimited number of alarms for different times/days of the week etc...I purchased this phone for use on AT&T; with an existing sim card and it works fine.

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: Emily
Reviews.Content: I love phones that have a keyboard. and this phone also has a touch screen for modern day technology. its easy to  use

Reviews.Title: Best phone I've had in years
Reviews.Author: Kat
Reviews.Content: I got this phone in December, 2011, and it has been perfect for me ever since. I've dropped it practically everyday,  it was submerged in water twice, and it barely did anything!!! I mean, I have a few scratches on it and there's a tiny crack in the screen near the top of the phone, but it is perfect. This is a great phone.

Reviews.Title: Really great Smart and simple
Reviews.Author: Grisel Gallardo
Reviews.Content: I have a Galaxy but I bought this one to introduce my dad into the Smart phone world.I was liking for easy handle with big fingers, simple like and old phone, with the Smart Features.This cell has it all and more.I was able to stream videos, use Google voice, whatsapp, Facebook, and more... Great phone and very rugged

Reviews.Title: Shipping wasn't good
Reviews.Author: Marian
Reviews.Content: I could not believe that they put this phone in the same box that we had placed another order for a tripod a few days before we order this.  I am surprised that it didn't get broke by the weight of tripod.  We almost didn't see it in the box and almost throw it away.  Not good to business not to email someone to tell you that it is included in another order.

Reviews.Title: Can your phone withstand a 450-pound giant foot?
Reviews.Author: Nanny Springer "quilter/writer"
Reviews.Content: I'm pleased with this phone. Not pleased at all with AT&T;'s customer service--to get this puppy turned on took over 4 hours and I ended up having 5 different phone numbers, one at a time--but that's not the point of this review, now is it?!Features, Positives:Size feels right in my man-sized-although-I'm-female hand, screen and keys just the right size. User friendly and camera takes acceptable pics and videos. My Kindle charger fits this phone and vice versa, so even if I lose one cord, I have another. Even with my elderly hearing the reception is great.Features, Negatives:After a few uses, the keyboard slide felt a little loose. Since I do little to no texting, no problem.Absolutely stellar feature to me has been its toughness. My son, a 450-pound muscular monster in a size 16 shoe, stepped on the phone by mistake (at least he said it was). While the optional protective case was damaged and the battery cover popped out, the phone still works. True, the battery doesn't hold a charge now as well, but a replacement for both battery and protective cover is in the mail.Make sure you have a decent car charger plug that accepts USB. It's been a lifesaver.I would probably get my husband one of these but he's a little cell phone-challenged.

Reviews.Title: Didn't work for me
Reviews.Author: We share her Amazon
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed because I really wanted this to work out.  I have an AT&T; network SIM card from a working phone.  I was standing in the same location when I swapped the SIM.  The Pantech was able to read the directory entries from the SIM, so it was installed correctly.  However, it was not able to make calls, giving a message something like, "ERROR, NETWORK NOT RECOGNIZED".The description says, "Unlocked GSM 3G for AT&T;" so it's supposed to work,... but it didn't.  I sent it back to Amazon, got a full refund.  This is why I like using Amazon Prime for purchases.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for a pre-teen or younger teenager
Reviews.Author: Joseph J Allan
Reviews.Content: This is a perfect phone for a younger person who needs texting capability, but who does not need the power (and cost) of a smart phone. As my son would say, this is a good phone for teaching a child how to be responsible with a phone and it won't cost you much to replace it if it's lost or broken. And the keyboard is very easy to use ... much easier than a touch-screen keyboard.

Reviews.Title: garbage
Reviews.Author: Vitaly
Reviews.Content: after 2 months of usage the phone started to behave weirdly.it reboots itself without reason or if I open a keyboard sometimes.shutdowns sometimes ... loses mobile network for long time.so I must throw it and buy something better.I wanted to have simple but quality phone for low price, but lost 70$ on this garbage instead.

Reviews.Title: My First Smartphone
Reviews.Author: C. Eggleston
Reviews.Content: Coming from a dumb phone, I was very pleased with the functionality of this phone. Web browsing, videos, and games generally worked fine, although some games were too much for this phone to handle smoothly. Battery life was good, I generally only charged it once every 2 days unless I was making heavy use of it during the day.Call quality was decent, signal strength was not as high as my old dumb phone. I downloaded the Android OS update from Pantech's website shortly after receiving the phone, I had to unlock the phone again after doing this, so be warned.Biggest gripes I had for this phone was responsiveness. Dumb phone was extermely simple and fast, but trying to do something simple like pulling up the phone dialing app and calling a contact is a little sluggish in comparison. After moving to a nicer (and quite a bit more expensive phone), I still feel like it's just a tiny bit sluggish, and it just seems to be a malady that affects all smart phones.

Reviews.Title: Barely adequate
Reviews.Author: Jane Doe
Reviews.Content: I see that the reviews here are overwhelmingly positive. Perhaps I got a lemon and the problems are not intrinsic to the phone. For whatever it's worth, however, these are my thoughts.This is my first smartphone. I was looking for something really cheap that could be used in the U.S. and in other countries, since I live abroad but am in the U.S. frequently.It is barely adequate, in my opinion. I use it now mostly for reading books on Kindle, though the screen is quite small.Here are the cons:1. Battery life stinks, at least compared to my simple, non-smart phone, though I gather this is true of most smartphones.2. The highest the ring volume goes is way too low to be heard anywhere where there is any noise.3. It is incredibly slow, even for a person who is not used to the fastest computer or coolest smartphone.4. The screen often goes black for no apparent reason, and I have to slide the keyboard back and forth or do something else to get it back.5. When I turn it to the side or to the normal, upright position, often, it will not readjust itself, and I need to look at it sideways.6. I have repeatedly turned it off, only to find that the next time I look at it, it is on. I have taken to sliding the battery out each time I want to turn it off, just to make sure.Pros:1. It's cheap.2. The slideout keyboard is great. In fact, it's probably the best thing about the phone.Conclusions:1. It's incredibly frustrating to use.2. I hope someday to be able to afford a real smartphone.

Reviews.Title: Excellent beginner smartphone for little cash....
Reviews.Author: C. Lake
Reviews.Content: Some of the menus are not as user friendly, but for a starter android 2.2 (upgrades to 2.3 from their website) phone it is good, especially for the price, we dont use a data plan, we have a basic voice plan, added family texting, blocked all data and this phone works just fine on our ATT plan.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy-- The phone locked after reset
Reviews.Author: REZA KHANI
Reviews.Content: The Pantech P8000 Crossover phone is advertised as unlock phone; but, it locked after reset and it doesn't work with t-Mobile network.  Contacted the supplier and I didn't hear back.

Reviews.Title: Pretty good.
Reviews.Author: bisdak
Reviews.Content: Pantech is not a popular brand but I am very satisfied with the performance of the product.  Yes it is a little bit heavy but also strong.  I love the features and will recommend the product if they want something to last.  The battery works very well too and I seldom recharge the same.

Reviews.Title: Good for the price
Reviews.Author: Chris 315516 "CatRanch756"
Reviews.Content: For the money, this is a good phone.  It's no competition for the likes of the Galaxy 3 or 4 or other bigger, more modern smartphones.  ...but if all you need is something basic that works, and the screen size is not an issue, this is a decent choice.All I wanted was an unlocked, multi-band GSM smartphone that I could use internationally -- preferably something cheap.  This fit my needs well.The only thing I couldn't do: get Skype to work over a cell connection.  I am not sure if that's a T-Mobile UK issue or a Pantech issue.  Everything else worked fine.

Reviews.Title: WiFi, Talking, and Texting
Reviews.Author: Michael S. Gregg "Butch"
Reviews.Content: Was going to get the Sharp FX Plus, but after looking at many reviews, decided on this one.  The reviews said the Sharp was a good lower-end phone, while the Pantech Crossover was a good mid-range phone.I was looking for a phone with WiFi, and this one has it.  I do not wish to pay for a data plan, since I do not use my phone for anything but talking and texting.One problem, though, without a data plan, this phone cannot send or receive photos in texts.All in all, I would buy this phone again.

Reviews.Title: Good phone - great value
Reviews.Author: Central IL Amazon Buyer "J,J,&L;"
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent starter phone for either a younger user or an older user, simple to use and learn, smartphone that is not over complicated...

Reviews.Title: Overall, A Good Phone
Reviews.Author: WA8UOC
Reviews.Content: I purchased this phone as my ATT Pay as you go phone. I wanted a phone with a nice drop down QWERTY key pad and this one is very nice. The keys are a nice size with lots of room and have a nice tactical feel. At 4.62 oz it is heavier than I would like but ok.The one negative for me are the volume keys on the left side. The way it fits in my hand, I find I lower the volume without knowing it and then I miss calls and T.M.s.The two things I like the most are the keyboard and the main screen. When you first turn the phone on you can see at a glance if you have received a call or TM. You simply drag the logo to the center of the touch screen and it takes you right to the message.The camera is 3.0 Megapixel and works nicely.The phone has bluetooth but so far, I have not been able to pair it with my Plantronics headset. This may be me?The overall quality of the phone is good and the audio quality is good.I am happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: My mom uses this
Reviews.Author: Anh-Thu Nguyen
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant to get my mom this phone (she had been using a slide-up phone with a numerical keypad) because of the touchscreen and the small buttons on the keyboard, but I thought that since touchscreens are more and more prevalent, she'd better get used to a touchscreen.Thankfully, she loves the phone. She's not the most tech-savvy so there was (is) a learning curve for her. She gets frustrated and nervous easily (which added to my aforementioned hesitation) but it seems like she's having not too much trouble with this phone. She says it's the best phone she's ever had and doesn't mind the touch screen at all.The intention was to get my mom a basic phone, but I got a text from her the other day that said, "OMG! I just checked my email on this phone!" (she is on wifi; no data plan.) I don't want this to sound demeaning to my mother in any way, but if you're wondering how this phone will fare to the senior audience: if my mom can use it, so can yours.

Reviews.Title: works well
Reviews.Author: Robert Bass
Reviews.Content: So far I have had this phone for a couple of months now. The voice quality is clear. The phone need to be charged at least once a day but I understand that is an issue with many smart phone. However it hold a charge for about 15 hours before it get to one quarter of the battery capacity. The touch screen is fairly responsive. TheQWTR keys are a bit tiny considering I don't have large hands . The phone app occasionally has minor problemsbut it was easy to find another for free. Also it does not come with an SD card. Over all I think it is a good phone for the cost

Reviews.Title: michael
Reviews.Author: michael mason
Reviews.Content: its a wonderful phone i dont have any problem with it i always have the net were ever i go all my friends love it

Reviews.Title: Great Starter Cellphone
Reviews.Author: ThomasB
Reviews.Content: We bought three of these cellphones. I can text take pictures, etc without any trouble. It sure beats paying several hundred dollars for a Samsung or I-Phone smartphone and meets my family's needs at this time.....

Reviews.Title: Good phone. Great price.
Reviews.Author: Staniella
Reviews.Content: After my HTC Desire started to lose its mind, I decided I wanted to have the same smart phone options while also offering me the simplicity of a full keyboard. This phone was exactly that! As I have large hands, it was a pain trying to type messages using a touch screen so the slide out keyboard saved me from my thumbs. The phone is compact, light and easy to use. The phone is also very study and I receive and make static and call-drop free calls. The screen is tough, the body is resilient and overall the fact that it uses the Google Play store for app downloads and purchases makes me happy. With a click or two I can re-download games I'd already purchased to the new phone without the hassle of paying for them all over again. The only complaint that I have is that I occasionally lose reception but it tends to be for no more than 2 minutes and like I stated before, it's only on occasion. Unlike the HTC desire, it doesn't freeze, drop calls, or shut off sporadically. When I researched the phone and saw that it was released in 2008, I felt like I was downgrading but it has been the best downgrade ever. Older model, better services. I'm a happy camper.

Reviews.Title: NEW TOUCH PHONE
Reviews.Author: Lisa Wilkins
Reviews.Content: LIKE IT BETTER HAVE TO USE IT FOR AWHILE TO GET USE TO IT KEY BOARD GREAT AND SIZE IS JUST RIGHT WOULD BUY IT AGAIN FOR A FRIEND OR RELATIVE

Reviews.Title: OMG, love it
Reviews.Author: tweetie "may"
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research for an inexpensive android unlock phone, this one has the most 4 to 5 stars ratings, it truly deserves the rating.  Setup was easy, has a tutorial to help out.  Asa it's charged, I put my Walmart SIM card in, da la, I began to explore the possibilities.  Love love the big text keyboards.Definitely recommend for someone just want some conveniences, quick search, and especially who loves to text, you won't be disappointed, well worth the money.  AM Happy �WowUpdate: 3 days after have the phone, the battery fully charged Wednesday night, but Thursday morning all drained. I suppose I activated too many auto update program, so undo the auto updates.  Hopefully it'll prolong battery life now.  I noticed the battery charged to 99% and stay at 99% for a long time, unable to figure it out yet, anyone have the answer?  Still happy.

Reviews.Title: Excelent Phone, Very Quick and Simple to Manage
Reviews.Author: Norberto Teixeira
Reviews.Content: -Very easy to handle-Very easy to configure-Its so easy to manage and the resolution is perfect-Deserve 5 stars

Reviews.Title: Pantech P 8000
Reviews.Author: KERI
Reviews.Content: The seller of this phone this a very good job shipping it to me on time, I think the phone came earlier than was expected. It was reasonable priced too... I have had no problem with the phone so far and I have been using it for a couple months now.  I wish the processor in the phone was fastest than it is though. It is a very good phone all in all.

Reviews.Title: Pantech P8000
Reviews.Author: WALLEYE22IN "WALLEYE22IN"
Reviews.Content: Some of the Keys used for typing text, stopped working but too much of a hassle to return so will continue using...walleye22in

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: Earlene M. Sorrells "Pebs"
Reviews.Content: I love this phone! it has the keyboard and the letters are large enough to see with ease and the buttons are large enough to use with ease.

Reviews.Title: Phones working in excellent condition.
Reviews.Author: Dan
Reviews.Content: Got what I expected. Yes they come with android 2.2 unlocked and they work fine. Good price and it is a smartphone. Only bad thing is has no flash for pictures but for the price who cares. I got two at $68.99 each, If you do the update offered in Pantechs website, the update to 2.3 will lock the phone again to At&T.; I was able to unlock the phone for $7.99, lowest price found at [...]They were fast to achieve this. Thanks-

Reviews.Title: Perfect phone for the price
Reviews.Author: Ryan
Reviews.Content: This phone has really met the exact need I had. It is powerful to run my email and Facebook stuff, and holds a charge twice as long as the Google Nexus S I got rid of.It is not without it's drawbacks, but they are advertised, so I won't complain. Be aware that this phone will not run Adobe Flash, and it also does not have a flash with the camera. I guess it has several flash problems (sorry, had to...).The camera is mediocre at best, so if that is important to you, stay away. But for the price, this phone blows away the competition, and I would buy another in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: Started out a great little phone...until the return window closed.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: At first I thought this phone was great, especially for the price. It had everything I was wanting in terms of a slide out keyboard, it had a nice interface, and was responsive. Much better than the other phones I had tried for this price.However, after two months of use, the "home" button has stopped working. This means that anytime I open the web browser, the only way to get out is to shut down the phone-the back button only takes you as far as the first page you viewed. This is the case with several other apps as well. As you can imagine, this is HIGHLY inconvenient and really renders the phone almost worthless. It would be one thing if it was the function button that doesn't really do much, or the quick search button...but since it's the home button, I can't do anything on my phone anymore without shutting it all the way down and having to wait for it to turn back on. Since the return window is one month, not two, I can't return it or receive any sort of refund or replacement.Tl;dr-This phone is great until the return window closes, and then a major function breaks rendering the phone useless.

Reviews.Title: Superlative value in an unlocked GSM with keyboard
Reviews.Author: G. BLAIR "GBlair"
Reviews.Content: Broke my old Samsung T359 from TMobile. I'm naturally a bit clumsy with small touch-screens, so I wanted a replacement device with a keyboard. Android and Wifi were "nice to haves". This phone has it all - just popped in my old TMobile prepaid SIM from the remains of my T359 and I was up and running. Totally, utterly painless. Web browsing via Wifi is totally functional, texting works as expected (nice keyboard, btw!) and oh yes - it works as a regular, talkie phone, too!I think the value in this is incredible. It feels a bit flimsy, but that means it will fall less hard when I eventually drop it, too! I would definitely recommend a case as an almost-essential accessory. Highly recommended as an inexpensive Android device (with all that implies) and unlocked GSM phone.

Reviews.Title: Good deal for the price
Reviews.Author: maserras
Reviews.Content: Nice android based phone, Very fast. Good keyboard. Excellent price. The camera is only 3 MP, but for me that is ok. Be aware that you can not take pictures unless you install it a memory card. I might order more.

Reviews.Title: great service
Reviews.Author: tammy peters
Reviews.Content: My phone arrived broken , the company is fast about exchanging this phone for me great customer service will recommend to all my friends

Reviews.Title: Pantech 8000
Reviews.Author: Evan Thompson
Reviews.Content: Great cell phone.  No issues.  Very satisfied.  Highly recommend.  For the money, this is a good entry level smart phone.

Reviews.Title: Excellent android phone for the price!
Reviews.Author: Tom
Reviews.Content: I'm using this phone with T-Mobile and so far I have no complaints. It runs great with wi-fi and the speed of the phone overall is acceptable. If using apps consistently, occasionally the phone will become glitchy or touchscreen will be irresponsive for a moment but, this goes for any phone. The slideout keyboard is great but, on screen keyboard works just as well. For the price it can't be beat. I did not install the free android upgrade many others have warned about since I did not want it relocking my phone. For my use the system it comes with works perfectly fine. Battery life is average...It will last slightly over a day if used for normal texting and a call or two. If using the web and apps constantly, it needs to be charged in the morning and evening.

Reviews.Title: Pantech Crossover P8000
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This is a terrific phone, it does more than you'd expect from a telephone priced under $100, I paid $65 and I would have everyone in my family own one. It does great with apps, email, obviously messaging, great slide out full keyboard but of course it is touch screen as well.I bought mine from PMG Distributors, they are excellent people, very good with CS, and nice people.The only thing that could be a negative is limited phone rings, and sound even at maximum level is not as loud as I'd like it but it is quite honestly a minor nuisance.

Reviews.Title: back case doesn't fit properly
Reviews.Author: sandra e elie
Reviews.Content: Nice phone, however the back case I have to tape down in order for it to close.  I contacted the seller for a replacement back case and I cannot get one.  I would have to send the phone back.

Reviews.Title: Great PHONE when you upgrade it
Reviews.Author: uveprom
Reviews.Content: You must download and upgrade the android os on the phone, it will be locked again but you can ask for the code free at [...] IT WORKS.

Reviews.Title: Problems with back of phone
Reviews.Author: MCW
Reviews.Content: Phone has just arrived but thought I would mention the problems with the back case. I returned my first phone because the back would not stay on. This second one the back slides on easily and stays on. So it is not a design problem (which I suspected) but rather that some of the backs are perhaps warped?  So if your's doesn't slide on properly (you can see on both sides that there is a gap when put on properly) try exchanging it for one that does work. As noted- no SD card, but the description does not mention one. Now I have to figure out how to work with it as it is my first vaguely smart phone. I am rathing it a 5 star because this phone completely corrects the problem I had with the first one but refers only to the back. I haven't even turned it on yet.

Reviews.Title: Great phone!
Reviews.Author: M. Delgado
Reviews.Content: This is my first smartphone and it's easy to navigate.  It has a lot of great features, and I've already dropped it several times without causing damage.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Qwerty Phone
Reviews.Author: Chris St Pierre
Reviews.Content: My daughter still insisted on a qwerty phone so as I shopped for a new one I came across this model. One request was that it not be an LG. Bought a sim card from Straight Talk, activated it and there you go. The phone is built well and has a cool new look. Not high end but with the low cost service it is a great beginner android phone as well.

Reviews.Title: Pantech 8000 Crossover
Reviews.Author: PVB
Reviews.Content: I like that it has two options to text and view items and that you can quickly switch between windows. I like having a lock option and a sleep mode. I don't like that the text background stays black and that sometimes it runs slow when I have more than one window open.  The screen can freeze often and you may have to turn off the screen and back on to unfreeze it. Out of 1-5 I give it a three.

Reviews.Title: Good phone but very slow
Reviews.Author: Abraham Kunkle "Aby"
Reviews.Content: Its a good phone but kind of slow. After start it takes 2 mins to come up. Tried to upgrade the OS to gingerbread but the installation always failed.

Reviews.Title: Great bang for the buck and tough as well.
Reviews.Author: greg
Reviews.Content: This phone is awesome.  For the money it can't be beat in a entry level android phone.  I had it a week and it was run over by a car and thought for sure it would be dead.  Nope,  everything worked, screen cracked be still worked just as though it was never damaged.  I recommend it for anyone that wants to spend a little to get a lot.

Reviews.Title: Poor performance from the start!
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey Doan "Covered Wagon"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this as my first "smart phone".  The only good thing I have found is the price.On average 3 of 5 calls are not received when the phone goes to the voice mail instead of ringing.  Ringtones are all musical or odd tones.The maximum ring volume is too low to hear unless I am holding it in my hand.  Even with downloaded "ring" ringtones, I cannot hear the ring if it is in a belt pouch.The device requires a very strong signal strength.  When my Motorola W450 flip phone reads 5 bars signal strength, the Pantec P8000 reads 3 bars or less!I wish I had waited and bought a different phone.

Reviews.Title: It's very nice
Reviews.Author: codez
Reviews.Content: The only reason I'm giving it 4 stars Is because I had some difficulty on setup First off what Happened to the 2 gigabyte card that comes preinstalled from The manufacturer It appears to be missing, the box (which was opened by the way)  said it was supposed to have 2 gigbyte card prestalled, but it did not. Second of all there's no instructions, only a piece of paper that shows you have to put the phone together and that's it, it has no sim card you can use your existing 1 or you have to buy 1 But overall it seems to be a good phone and I'm enjoying it, it's also my first smartphoneThe phone can be used with AT&T; or T Mobile (I have AT&T;)EDIT:Okay first of all I written a completely detailed review but due to an Amazon error it got wiped out. And typing is not my best thing sobut I'll type it all againFirst of all I'm gonna say this once if you've got a samsung galaxy s3 or fancy 500 dollar iPhone you'll be disappointed in all the features this phone has to offerOkay I upgraded from an lg cu 920 this was considered a feature phone or some people call it dumb phonesFirst off I set the phone can be used with T Mobile. This isn't completely accurate this phone will only use T Mobile old 2g network. You can still make calls text messages and use the internet but there is no 3g internet service.And also let you know that there is a version upgrade available for Android. but doing so will lock the phone to AT&T;'s network even if you been using T Mobile, you won't be able to use T Mobile after the Android upgrade. It is possible to root the phone to regain access to T Mobile. but if you don't know a lot about phones then you're pretty well out of luck and I don't know if you can downgrade once you upgraded. Factory resetting the phone won't restore the old version of Android.Now the GPS.I've used GPS and it's been accurate no problems with it. But still is not as accurate as a stand alone GPS. But for me it's good enough for turn by turn directionsNow the touch screenThe touch screen is been accurate for my BIG fingers. But sometimes it acts up and just randomly put stuff in text messages and your typing on the touch screen and it just goes haywire. I find that cleaning the screen just by breathing on it and wiping With your shirt will stop that problem. Until the screen becomes dirty again and I highly suggest you keep your hands clean went touching the screen.The screen has some great picture from my old phone, but you'll be disappointed if you're used to a iphone screen. The definition is not as good and the screens a bit smaller then an iPhone but the same size as my old phone. So I'm use to itBattery lifeCompare to my old phone battery life on this phone is. i say it's poor. I only talk maybe 5 minutes on my phone a day. I use GPS maybe once or twice a week, but I didn't find in to drain my battery like people complain it does, and the GPS runs for 30 minutes at a time. The screen brightness, I turned mine down halfway and for me it saves a good bit of better life since my screen is on moes of the day and I can still see the phone even and direct daylight. I listen to music at hours at a time at least 5 or 6 hours at 1 time and find out even with my headphones plugged in directly into the phone it barely drains the battery, now using my wireless Bluetooth headphones it drains more battery, a little noticeable but not much. And I use wifi on the phone for 4 to 6 hours a day and send maybe 200 text messages a day. But the real battery drain on this phone is the cellular antenna what connects it to AT&T; or T Mobile if you want to save battery life cut airplane mode on, but doing so what disable your ability to receive or make calls. Send and receive text messages and data communication over cellular, you can cut WiFi and Bluetooth back on and the cellular disabled. The battery life is good for me.Now the cameraMy old phone took some gorgeous picture where I was able to run to Walmart get special photo paper for my printer print it out get a frame from the dollar store frame it and it looked like a professional did it. But this phone supposed to have a better camera on it so I thought even better pictures. But shockingly it take some blurry photos. I'll continue messing around with the camera settings to see if I can find something that works better and when I do I'll post them back on hereRecording video completely destroys my old phone. It records much better video than my last phone which is shocking. But doesn't record video or take pictures like a good real smartphone.The way this thing takes video, you install apps and everythingI recommend you get a memory card. at least 8GB. The phone supports up to a 32 gigabyte memory card.AT&T; still pre loaded the phone with a bunch of junk full, Useless apps that you can't uninstall. but you can refuse to update them and save your memory. And a little tip some apps won't automatically put them self's on the memory card your have to do that yourself and you can save yourself even more memory that way.Durability now. I've dropped the phone a couple times but no scratches no signs of damage of wear and tear. Even with sliding the phone open and shut there's no signs of wear and tear.This phone has some hits and misses. And even if I knew all the problems with the phone before I even bought it I would still buy it again. this phone is a huge step up of my old phone. I like it, I only paid 80 bucks, I'll keep itIf you have any questions leave me a comment and I'll try to get back to you.

Reviews.Title: BAD
Reviews.Author: Nicole Stephens
Reviews.Content: I hate the phone, its so horrible, it force closes all the time and the battery will die even if you aren't using it.I DO NOT RECOMMEND!

Reviews.Title: Disappointing
