Reviews.Author: L.
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone because I wanted a basic phone with a good qwerty keyboard for texts. Keyboard is great, screen quality is good, but options for customization are few. Sound quality and speaker phone quality are really poor. Touch screen for calculator app is poor and often unresponsive or registers the wrong key. Battery life is poor (goes dead even when no calls are made all day). Would recommend for a child's first phone maybe.  (Pantech P8000)

Reviews.Title: Works excellent on Straight Talk
Reviews.Author: Usafloadc17
Reviews.Content: My mom needed an ATT phone on straight talk because most of the android ST phones work on Sprint, which has horrible service.  Upgraded to Gingerbread for free and popped in the ATT Straight Talk sim and it works like a champ.

Reviews.Title: Nice phone
Reviews.Author: Shannon Alexander
Reviews.Content: My son loves it.  He likes the sliding keypad.  He has also dropped it several times and it still works.

Reviews.Title: It's ok as a starter phone
Reviews.Author: cheapterbythedozen
Reviews.Content: It's ok if you are looking for a basic phone with a slide out keyboard.  It's slow and old technology and I wouldn't recommend it if you have any desire for speed.  However, it is physically durable and has decent sound quality. A good starter phone.

Reviews.Title: Nice phone but...
Reviews.Author: Jessica L. Smith
Reviews.Content: It is a nice phone but they put an emergency button on the lock screen... So... When our baby (2 years old now) gets a hold of the phone there are many calls to 911. Just beware if u have young kids and keep the phone out of reach! Also, it may get hit if it is in your pocket. I don't know who came up with that idea but it was not smart!

Reviews.Title: This phone works well.
Reviews.Author: Axeman "SCRAM"
Reviews.Content: I have extra phones with T-Mobile's Gold Card plan that I keep in the cars in case our real phones run out of battery or the Verizon network is unavailable, etc.  I use this as one of the extra phones.  It works well and I really like the interface.

Reviews.Title: Thank you!
Reviews.Author: Lois
Reviews.Content: I want a full querty keyboad and received it.  I was skeptical whether it would be new or not because I did not want refurbished and it is brand new.  I received free shipping and my new phone came three days after order with a nice note attached letting me know what to do if there were a problem and to thank me.  Quite courteous, prompt, professional.  Also, this is a Green Facility which helps to make our beautiful world a little more livable and proud to call her Mother Earth.  This is a good phone.  I have another one and there is nothing wrong with it but was worried I would not be able to get another querty.  Now I have a replacement, if/when needed.  It would be nice if the phone company would let you have another phone with the same number to just have at the house and not to have to worry--where's my phone.  Thank you for having this in stock and available.

Reviews.Title: Old phone, can't upgrade, small screen.
Reviews.Author: A. DELARA "alexdelara"
Reviews.Content: If you reset to factory, it looses the unlock, so have the code handy.I havent tried to upgrade the firmware, but why the trouble for such small screen ?It's still a good entry phone for a middle-schooler or if you need a backup phone.Recommended: no - look for something more modern.

Reviews.Title: complicated but usable
Reviews.Author: an old man
Reviews.Content: I find the unit to be fairly complicated after using the Pantech 9020 for several years.  Since we use only the voice feature it is acceptable..

Reviews.Title: BEST phone for price
Reviews.Author: Mary Beth Golden
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with this phone, I am still shocked at how inexpensive it was compared with how nice it is!

Reviews.Title: Good product
Reviews.Author: Brennan Ogburn
Reviews.Content: obviously not a new 4.42 android, but hey, it is better than "the brick" my wife was using before! Definately a good product and would recommend to anyone looking for a simple yet modern cell phone for AT&T;!

Reviews.Title: It was alright
Reviews.Author: Chance
Reviews.Content: I ordered two- they came without manuals and I needed help with them.  I didn't realize that they were "smart" phones- so I had to pay more to make them work on my plan.  At least with AT&T; you must have a data plan to receive pictures on these.  They work fine- except that one came with a charger that is loose- we tried a different charger and it works fine.

Reviews.Title: Some apps are bank killers
Reviews.Author: Matt-Man
Reviews.Content: Got this phone because my old Pantech battery was dying and a new P8000 was not a ton of dough. The cost to buy a phone was only a little more than a new battery so I splurged.Pros: The slide out keyboard is great! The MAIN reason I bought the phone is a winner.The display is clear and easy to use. I've never had a touch screen phone before and I got the hang of it pretty quickly.Cons: Accessing the web from this phone is a money suck. I signed up for GoogleMail thinking is was free, only to find that I was dinged about $40 for data. AT&T; credited me back and turned off web access so I can't accidentally run up a big Internet bill.Overall, the more I play with and use this phone the better I like it since it is easier to use than my older Pantech. One thing that was very odd was the owners manual was almost unreadable. It looked like it had been printed in someone's basement on an old dot-matrix printer.

Reviews.Title: Adequate
Reviews.Author: CoC Believer
Reviews.Content: Fine for the price. No complaints. Sturdy and compact. My boy is sad it won't let him download some of his favorite games, but that's okay. No phone is perfect.

Reviews.Title: Pantech P8000 Crossover Adventure Phone
Reviews.Author: zaida Mundarain
Reviews.Content: This phone is a very good item, I bought it for my nephew, he is happy with it because the phone does what it promises

Reviews.Title: Not Good
Reviews.Author: joseph Buckmire
Reviews.Content: This product is OK, not the best. I will not recomend this phone to any one. because it don't have Wi Fi.

Reviews.Title: AT&T; IS CONSIDERED A QUICK MESSAGEING PHONE NO DATA PLAN REQUIRED
Reviews.Author: Nelly "Nelly"
Reviews.Content: This phone does not require a 30$ data plan with AT&T.; be sure you go into settings: wireless & network settings:mobile network: turn data services off. To not be charged. be sure that AT&T; has the correct IMEI for this phone and does not bill you as a smart phone

Reviews.Title: basic android
Reviews.Author: carian allen
Reviews.Content: This is a basic android that works well considering the cost. One major setback is that it does not have a lot of storage space, but otherwise its ok.

Reviews.Title: Perfect cheap replacement for my old phone
Reviews.Author: ANDRE L. DE GRAAF
Reviews.Content: Works great and I did not have to renew my contract for another two years. Who need the latest and greatest phone anyway? If your not a slave to tech, then this phone is perfect.

Reviews.Title: Sold as 'unlocked' but may not be: Has issues with Hotspot/tethering and non AT&T; companies
Reviews.Author: khaled m abdelhamid
Reviews.Content: I purchased this phone sometime ago.  Overall I like it very much.  It is an older phone with and older Android version and a small screen but has been very reliable and has great battery life, signal reception, call quality, reliable WiFi and Bluetooth.  But......The phone is sold as unlocked, HOWEVER it does NOT work with any T-Mobile cards.  It requests an unlock pin number for the new network.  Also, as I tries to use its HotSpot option it did not accept the command and gave a message to call AT&T; to unlock the Hotspot function.  I used it with Straight Talk (which uses AT&T; network in St. Louis Missouri USA where I live, and oversees in the middle East without problems. So, if it is unlocked, it is NOT FULLY unlocked.

Reviews.Title: good starter phone
Reviews.Author: horse whisperer
Reviews.Content: This phone is a good starter android smartphone. it is fairly simple with a upgrade to gingerbread 2.3.6 this though will lock the phone and you have to pay a few bucks to unlock it. I unlocked it through Release My Code. They are partnered up with T-mobile and so I got a 10% discount on it. Honestly despite having to pay money I think the update we worth it. It made the phone even easier to use and the software was much better plus I could get some better apps with it.prosnice roomy keyboardok 3mp cameranice function keyhandles youtube wellvery low storagetoughmicro sd card slot ( I can fit 32gb)consno front camerano flashsucks at playing movies and appsbulkyheavyslowlaggycrashed very often for meif the cons don't bug you and you don't want this to play very many games or watch netflix and just do social network stuff and text then for $80 this is a good deal. but don't get if you do want to play games and watch movies because as I already said this can't do it.

Reviews.Title: Pretty OK
Reviews.Author: Faye
Reviews.Content: Pretty good phone over all, but the screen is a little tough to work with sometimes. It has a couple kinks that I have had to call and get assistance in fixing, but nothing too major.

Reviews.Title: Great little cheap phone, might be better options available now though.
Reviews.Author: Fozzie
Reviews.Content: This is one sturdy little phone!!  I use it only as a backup when I'm between phones or have to send my main phone in for repair.  I've dropped this phone more times then I can count and it still works great.Cons:  Screen size, uses full sized SIM cards, single core CPU which does struggle a lot.Pros:  Cheap, durable, runs 2.3 android, full physical keyboard.Misc:  If you don't mind Windows there are some newer, dual core, Windows phones out now with larger screens for around the same price as the P8000.

Reviews.Title: Missing microsd card, may not be unlocked
Reviews.Author: Nandan Garg
Reviews.Content: good for the price. I like the slide out keyboard. But the phone is slow. had a dead pixel upon arrival. Did not had the 2GB microsd card as the box said. Please contact your seller and confirm that it has the card since some of them take it out when they unlock the phone. My phone was not unlocked as it was promised but I realized when I was in another country and tried another sim.

Reviews.Title: Unless this is your first, you won't like it
Reviews.Author: Christine Johnson
Reviews.Content: I replaced it with a used Blackberry and am happier.  This phone has a nice weight and feel but doesn't do what other smart phones do.  It is not particularly easy to use.  The price was OK.  The product was probably OK, but....

Reviews.Title: Pretty good for a cheap smartphone but glitchy
Reviews.Author: Jess
Reviews.Content: I've had this phone for a bit over a month now. Inserted my T-mobile SIM card and I can confirm that the phone is definitely unlocked.No data plan and I haven't installed the Android Gingerbread update yet so I cannot comment on that but currently, the phone is glitchy at times. GPS function does not appear to be working half the time which is a big nuisance for me since I like having GPS to track my runs. One time I had both the music player and a run tracking app running and the phone froze for over an hour even though the music was still playing and the GPS was still running. Had to take out the battery. Also, I can receive calls while I'm running but the person on the end is never able to hear what I'm saying while I hear them perfectly. Not sure if these issues persist because a) I haven't updated the phone, b) the gps/apps I'm running interfere with phone function, c) using t-mobile on AT&T; phone or d) phone is just glitchy. The camera quality is OK. There is long pause before the picture is taken as well as a loud shutter noise.Otherwise I like this phone. Very sturdy and doesn't feel cheap. I can use most of the apps I use on my iPod Touch even though I still prefer my iPod touch since everything is much faster and runs more smoothly on there. I like being able to use a phone capable of wifi without needing to have a data plan. I can check my email, social networks, listen to music, watch videos, etc. Battery life is decent. Keyboard is nice and large for texting. (However, unable to receive picture messages since I have not figured out the APN settings.)I will update this review if I get around to updating the phone.

Reviews.Title: not as good as I expected but still a good phone
Reviews.Author: Rebeca Hubble
Reviews.Content: I used this phone for about 4 months before my daughter inadvertently sent it through the washing machine to its death.  With its high reviews on Amazon I expected more from it, but it is still a good phone for the price.Pros:-I found the memory and internal storage sufficient.  I downloaded about 20 apps and never had an issue with storage space.-I also found the battery life adequate--never great, as in virtually all androids, but always adequate.-Everything else works.  It never froze or anything.Cons:-The camera is pathetic.  Without a flash, it exposes the lens way too long, and unless your subject is perfectly still, it will be fuzzy.  There is also a very long shutter lag.-The screen is not terribly responsive.  Quite often I had to try a few times before it would notice a gesture.  It is also telling that when slowly scrolling down to read something, it would shimmy.I will also mention a couple of things that are not quite cons but I found a little annoying:-It was at first quite annoying that the home and menu buttons are hardware buttons, but the back and search buttons are touchscreen.  Who thought of that?  For the first couple of months, I was constantly pushing too hard on the back, or too soft on the home or menu.  I eventually got used to it, though.-I got this phone for the keyboard, since I am used to blackberry typing.  While there is nothing wrong with the slider keyboard, I found that even after several months, it was just as slow as typing on a touch screen.  There is something about the long, skinny layout, where your thumbs have to travel a ways, that makes a slider less effective.  I did like the cursor buttons, though.-I would also mention that with a ptel (tmobile) sim, I found the signal not as good as my pageplus (Verizon) phone, but that is probably more an issue with the carrier than the phone.

Reviews.Title: great phone
Reviews.Author: chaky
Reviews.Content: the phone is as discrived in good conditions I like the pantech p-8000 because is a great phone works great on wifi and is a fast downloader for apps

Reviews.Title: Great phone
Reviews.Author: A. Turner
Reviews.Content: I chose this phone becuase I like to have the actual keyboard and the touch screen. This phone works great for me, I primarily use it for calls, texting. web surfing, and music and games. The camera is nice too.

Reviews.Title: love this phone
Reviews.Author: Bobby
Reviews.Content: I like this phone works great, my fisrt time having a smartphone, still trying to understand everything and how it works, but I do like this phone a lot, just I hope this one last longer then the other phone I bought,

Reviews.Title: The battery life sucks
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: Ive had the phone for a good six months now and while I really dont have any major complaints on the use of the actual phone itself I really do despise the battery life. It wont even hold a charge for a day. And I turned off the wi-fi, Bluetooth and dimmed the screen. Nothing works. Do not buy this phone. Not worth what you pay for it.

Reviews.Title: Might as well be sold as a standered phone, smart features won't work.
Reviews.Author: Abigail Cassel
Reviews.Content: We bought the phone mainly for the GPS smartphone feature and after many attempts to try and figure it out the GPS is still not working.  This phone is useless to us, we might as well have bought a flip phone.  All we were told was to update the software, and by the time we decided it just wasn't going to ever work it was too late to return.  On top of that, unlike other android phone you can't resell this phone to make up some of your loss, most sites won't offer more than $10.

Reviews.Title: Excellent.
Reviews.Author: Billy J. Parker
Reviews.Content: I purchased this phone because I come from the blackberry community. I despise touch-screen texting, but I love the touch screen capability itself. It took about a week to get used too - but now I love this phone, it's my favorite of all time. It's on the heavy side which I would hope is indicative of quality construction, and so far that is the case. It's definitely not for everyone, but I think that is the point - it's for those who want the hard quality key-pad feature but still want the 'smart phone'.

Reviews.Title: Nice phone.
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: Phone was in perfect condition, love the features on it and if I had to would purchase it over again.

Reviews.Title: Perfect phone for a good price
Reviews.Author: CANDICE LEDBETTER
Reviews.Content: No complaints here! Easy to use, looks good, works great! Would recommend to anyone. Might buy another for my daughter!

Reviews.Title: easy to use
Reviews.Author: PJ
Reviews.Content: It works well for my use and as a overall good part to the cell thanks for a good product.

Reviews.Title: Very cheap and does everything I need!
Reviews.Author: little bad boy
Reviews.Content: I got this cheap for an android! It does almost everything I need!  Since it is running on Android 2.3, I have a wide choices of apps!  I even have a boxing timer for my workout!  It is kinda slow though. Camera takes excellent pictures but I wish it had a flash for nice night shots.  But hey, for its price a flash is not expected.

Reviews.Title: Just awesome
Reviews.Author: Mowglie
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone a year ago and it's a powerhouse! Don't let the processor specs fool you. I don't use it for anything to heavy but for normal use, Internet browsing, games, texting, etc. but I can't say it's ever lagged, this phone is really awesome.

Reviews.Title: The best of two worlds
Reviews.Author: Freddy
Reviews.Content: Perfect gift to learn the new technology, not too big not to small not to heavy or to light. camera is not so good but is better that other phones that are more expensive than this one. Love the options to type in the full keyboard as well in the touch screen keyboard or scribble option - I seen that before did not know about it - try it and is cool;  not all phones come with the scribble  option I love it. Phone has many features, very easy to use and learn, good price, easy to configure or at least for me it is very easy, good reception my co-workers do not get reception in the office and they have expensive phones latest technology and 0 signal - meanwhile I get 2 to 3 bars of signal and they wonder how  LOL

Reviews.Title: not a terrible phone
Reviews.Author: Me.
Reviews.Content: but theres better. its small, and the back cover doesnt stay on. Because the battery is slightly too thick. and you cant change the sd card without taking out the whole battery.

Reviews.Title: Good phone
Reviews.Author: Amber Blackledge
Reviews.Content: I have had this e for a while i am now on my second one. After i had the first one for about a year it began to have some glitching and i had to restart it a lot. I like the key board and it is a good size , it does well enough on the internet for how often i use it

Reviews.Title: Charge barrtery every day
Reviews.Author: J. Liu "whitelily"
Reviews.Content: I trun off wireless and most app.  I still have to charge it every day.  The battery life is terriable.  I switched back to my simple phone so I do not have to remember to charge all the time.

Reviews.Title: great phone
Reviews.Author: nan
Reviews.Content: this phone is a very good starter smart phone.It is a great texting phone cuz it has the slide out key board which I find much easier to useand it connects to the internet fast and easy.Glad I chose this phone

Reviews.Title: Great Phone for Price
Reviews.Author: B. Smith "bradgsmit"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this phone to use with my pay as you go plan that advertised bring any unlocked phone to use. This phone has worked great and I have had no problems with it. The phone was advertised as new however the box I received clearly had been previously opened. Not sure it the phone was actually ever used or not, nothing on the phone would indicate so. I also received a charger with mine. I know some of the reviews mentioned they did not, but mine came with one.

Reviews.Title: The rear cover didn't fit
Reviews.Author: WILLIAM
Reviews.Content: I ordered this to replace my Pantech P8000 that I accidently dropped in the trash can.  I received it on time.  After installing the micro-sd, SIM card, and battery I noticed that the rear cover would not slide and snap into place.  I tried several times to do so with no luck.  I got the cover from my old phone and it fit perfectly.  The phone works exactly like my old one.  The only problem was I lost all my phone contacts and will now have to rebuild the list.  The non-fitting cover is why I did not rate this as a five-star.

Reviews.Title: greatest phone ever worst battery
Reviews.Author: es
Reviews.Content: I am  a huge cel phone hater,dont want  a bunch of "smart phone"features to make me feel like an idiot,  just want a phone for talk and text! Imagine that. This phone does just that, no more no less! phone does everything simply., no guessing where it's taking you! you put in a comand and presto..it does just that!!!! The texting alpha pad keys are larger than most. Have AT&T; go phone plan, worked easily  w/no problem!!! The only compaint is the ring tone is not loud enough,that is a problem so i 'm forever checking which is a huge inconvienace but oh well I love this phone so i put up w/this one inconv..now for the battery.., the 1st week no juice was not happy put another batteryin  on loan fro a friend worked good still not great 10 hrs max decided to buy another backup recently I'll c if that improves. Not holding out to much hope

Reviews.Title: Good Phone
Reviews.Author: Rashid Abramov
Reviews.Content: not sure if it was truly unlocked, but overall a good phonenot too pricy and functional.just use it for calls and texting

Reviews.Title: daughter's first hybird smartphone
Reviews.Author: Rex
Reviews.Content: While not a true smartphone has all the features and apps neededFor a preteen learning to care and handle a first phone without the smartphonePrice. It allows the family tracking feature, as well as other management features4lte speeds, modest internet and even supports internet sharing throughA personal WiFi hotspot (service dependant).

Reviews.Title: Great phone for the price
Reviews.Author: BonnieRocks
Reviews.Content: It's a phone designed for those who need the basics and works Just as I hoped it would.  Thank you.

Reviews.Title: Its ok..
Reviews.Author: BruteNStones
Reviews.Content: I think for this price it's alright. But this phone is just way too unreliable for real emergency situations. I have to buy a new phone after a year of using this because it's not fast enough and takes me about 5 whole minutes sometimes 10 just to get through to talking or texting. I've had to sit in the sun waiting for this to load because it constantly freezes.If you are looking for something safe don't choose this I give it 2 stars because I think the phone is good but I deduct 3 because of the reasons above.

Reviews.Title: Perfect cheapie phone.
Reviews.Author: Sue G "mamasue"
Reviews.Content: I wanted a touch-screen phone with a keyboard, without a data plan, and this one got the best reviews.I wasn't disappointed....it has everything I need. The touch-screen is sensitive, the pullout keyboard is east to use.The camera is pretty good.... as good as my 'real' camera.Wifi works really well.....it's amazing how many public places have wifi!The battery runs down quite quickly if wifi and Bluetooth are on all the time...so I keep wifi off until I need to use it.I've had it 3 weeks now, and it fulfills my needs perfectly....Would definitely recommend it to a friend.

Reviews.Title: You Get What You Pay For
Reviews.Author: Michael Bass
Reviews.Content: It reboots all the time. If you search the web, it will reboot after about 2 mins of search. It also shuts off completely sometimes when not in use. This usually isn't discovered until it has been in my pocket for a little while. I pull it out to use it and have to turn it on, then discover I have a bunch of missed calls. If looking for an Android phone that is reliable, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: Impressed
Reviews.Author: Rahul Suri "what?"
Reviews.Content: The main reason that I got this phone is because it is supposed to work very well as phone. I liked the price. It works great as a phone.  I was not looking for much else. For its class I was pleasantly surprised at the internet ability.I upgraded the operating system and that locked the phone again. One of theother reviewers mention a site to go to get the unlock code, it worked great.As far the Wi-Fi connecting it has some trouble finding, availability. When it does it is fairly fast for its class. The sound is clear on speaker. I like listening to out of market baseball games and I am very satisfied with the performance.

Reviews.Title: for her price is very good
Reviews.Author: Jairo A Cortes R
Reviews.Content: works well, I buy it for the connection to wifi and just make phone calls, when you work with more applications becomes slow and may crash

Reviews.Title: Served it's purpose.
Reviews.Author: jigglyboo
Reviews.Content: My phone broke and I needed a cheap one temporarily until I upgraded my current phone a month later. It did exactly what I needed it to do without a lot of frills until my new phone arrived the following month. It's a good phone and I will definitely keep it in the drawer as a backup for any future emergencies

Reviews.Title: almost got a 4
Reviews.Author: Ricardo Matute
Reviews.Content: probably the best i have at the moment down part is that i love using my itunes or just mp3 ringtones but this phone cant play it you have to buy from the service store so its stupid and should be smaller came out not too long ago so why does it look like a block

Reviews.Title: cool
Reviews.Author: Queen V
Reviews.Content: i got this for my kid for xmas and she loves it no problems great starter phone for her to have

Reviews.Title: Overseas phone
Reviews.Author: Regular Joe
Reviews.Content: We bought this phone to use overseas and it worked just phone.  We mostly wanted to make and receive phone calls

Reviews.Title: Works wit Consumer Cellular!
Reviews.Author: Geert de Jonge
Reviews.Content: I switched to Consumer Cellular.  Not sure if that would work, but after a small conversation with one of their reps got it to work  in no time.  This phone is for my wife who wanted a keyboard for texting etc. .  It performs very well.  Also runs on wifi, at home and other hotspots.

Reviews.Title: Great phone
Reviews.Author: jun
Reviews.Content: The phone arrived in 2 days and all in order. This is my first Pantech and android and it was better than expected. It did not take long to begin using it. The sliding keyboard makes it easy to text and write notes which I often do. Phone calls are clear.  You can download apps for anything else the phone didn't come with. I was so satisfied I bought 2 more to give away as gifts. I knew that upgrading to gingerbread will lock the phone but did it anyway and it seems better. I just had it unlocked again and even with that extra cost it was still way less than $100.

Reviews.Title: unlocked phone.
Reviews.Author: judy
Reviews.Content: trying to get it to upgrade before I get a sims card for Straigt Talk ..Having a bit of a time trying to figure it out. My daughter has one on AT&T; and she likes it most of the time. SAys she has not had trouble with it freezing up and like to surf the web with it. she wishes the screen was a bit larger..but says the phone is a great buy if you want a go phone that is not so expensive.

Reviews.Title: EXCELENT
Reviews.Author: Christian
Reviews.Content: the product arrived just in time, it works very well , great cellphone, easy to use, there is just 1 problem, and it is with the apps, there is no so much compatibility, besides that it is perfect

Reviews.Title: Great phone at a great price.
Reviews.Author: Michael R. Henson
Reviews.Content: I paid $50 or so for mine and it was worth 3 times that amount at least. Solid phone that actually works great as both a phone and an android device.

Reviews.Title: Didnt work For me
Reviews.Author: lpast
Reviews.Content: Didnt work with the carrier I wanted it to work with. Im not sure if it wasnt unlocked or not

Reviews.Title: Worth the price, my son is very happy with it.
Reviews.Author: Orville tucker
Reviews.Content: My 14 year old son lost his phone and we needed a cheap replacement. Since he previous phone was an android phone, he had to have another that also supported android.This was a great price for a new android phone. He likes the phone better than his lost phone.Battery life seems good. I liked the way the keyboard felt when I checked it out.Overall, I think this is a great buy and a great price.

Reviews.Title: Exceeded my expectations by a lot!
Reviews.Author: Daniel Liberto
Reviews.Content: Love  the phone, fast, basic, keyboard is great! Battery lasts a long time too. I need to get words in.

Reviews.Title: Nice for my first smart phone.
Reviews.Author: Judy M Selleck
Reviews.Content: I'm not very techy, and I'm still learning about my new phone, but it seems to be fairly easy, and works quite well with my wifi.  My phone could use a booster for the cell service in my location though.

Reviews.Title: Awesome phone
Reviews.Author: Jaime Harding
Reviews.Content: awesome phone I love it! The price was great too! I'm glad I bought the phone it has defently helped me out a lot.

Reviews.Title: Good phone
Reviews.Author: Fatih
Reviews.Content: I upgraded it to 2.3 before using it much, so I can't comment on the  base phone. But since, upgrade is free and fast and requires almost no skills, I don't see why anybody wouldn't upgrade it.Everything works just the way I want it. I thought the alarm clock could have improvements, but that is the beauty of android. Just download another one and give it a shot.If you do want to play swf files, you might have problems. But youtube or any other flash based web pages work just fine. So for 99.9% of this phone owners, there shouldn't be any problems.

Reviews.Title: Unexpected
Reviews.Author: jackson12
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic phone. keyboard not 2 small. screen is the perfect size, not to mention how loaded the phone is. Just purchased another one for a friend!

Reviews.Title: Good Phone!
Reviews.Author: Tracey Johnson
Reviews.Content: Love my phone.  Was dissapointed at first because I thought it was going to be a little bigger but I love it now.

Reviews.Title: Nice phone for the price
Reviews.Author: Andy Gordley
Reviews.Content: I like the phone!  It works well.Pros:-Price-Features-Full keyboard-Nice screen-Good sensitivity to touchCons:Thick and heavy.

Reviews.Title: excelente Telefono y Buen Precio!!
Reviews.Author: Alejandro B.
Reviews.Content: Muy buen precio, se puede actualizar a una mejor versión de Android, 100% compatible con los operadores en Colombia, gran compra.

Reviews.Title: GOOD PHONE FOR THE PRICE
Reviews.Author: shb717
Reviews.Content: I purchased this phone because of several reasons: I've never had any android device and i needed a cheap phone that would just work. Well in those terms the phone met all requirements and it runs just smooth. So far I have been happy with the purchase, but when i learnt about the possibility to upgrade to android 2.3, that offers broader functionality the troubles started.The official software obtained from pantech official web-site would not recognise the device, neither the PC suite would. The device driver software seems not to be fully operational. These would be the reasons I rate it as I do. for the rest the device is just great. Would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Nice phone for the money.
Reviews.Author: Oompahloompah "cootiedog"
Reviews.Content: I like this phone.  The touch screen is very responsive.  My only issue with this phone is that the back does not stay on very well.  My husband has the same phone and has the same issue.

Reviews.Title: Great phone - these phones work well and seem to be good quaility
Reviews.Author: CHAD H COLE
Reviews.Content: I bought three of these after purchasing another model that turned out to be terrible. My wife and son and I really like these phones. Although the version of Android is a little outdated, we've been able to install all of the apps we were interested in.They seem to be good quality and have held up well, though we've only had them for a week or so.

Reviews.Title: GREAT FIRST TOUCH SCREEN
Reviews.Author: Diamond Jenkins
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone to switch over to the solavei network. It is a solid phone and does everything as stated. I  like  it my first touch screen but i don't like the battery  plugin are. it is a little annoying to dig the protectice cover. i am purchsing these phones in bulk for my business. Worth a shot!

Reviews.Title: I like this phone a lot.
Reviews.Author: C. Hintz "Om Gate"
Reviews.Content: I got the phone, activated it and it worked flawlessly.  The keyboard is nice for texting and web.  The sensitivity of the RF section is better than my old phone so I never experienced breakup or a dropped call.  I am transitioning this phone over to NET10 next month for unlimited voice, text, and data at 1/2 the cost.

Reviews.Title: Pantech P8000 Crossover Adventure Phone
Reviews.Author: Josh
Reviews.Content: Am writing review same day as opening phone:Seems to be working well: Easy connecting to my WiFi and and touch screen works beautifully. Phone responded well to change in orientation and i found both the on screen keypad and hard Qwerty keypad to be quite responsive and accurate. I liked the ease of use in adding applications to the "functions" key to make shortcuts and enjoyed some of the pre-installed apps on it. My phone shipped with a 2 GB memory card- which is nice if you want to snap pictures of yourself celebrating your new phone or just simply like taking videos of  nothing important and sharing with uninterested friends.Pictures aren't bad indoors and phone easily was able to attach a video to an email.The back cover closed tightly against the back of phone (unlike a previous one bought on Amazon form Tablet Distributors) which didn't close snugly and I returned it. - Due to another user's comments of having a problem with the back cover closing and switching it, and the problem being taken care of.

Reviews.Title: Great phone
Reviews.Author: Mary Lerman
Reviews.Content: My first Android, very exciting. Keyboard a little stiff and somewhat confusing until you learn how to use it. Good value for a low price.

Reviews.Title: le doy 4 estrellas por la calidad del producto
Reviews.Author: Ricardo Aponte.
Reviews.Content: muy buen teléfono muy practico y con todo lo básico para los trabajos que necesiten,  en pocas palabras un producto que cumple.

Reviews.Title: We've bought three of these now
Reviews.Author: SunSea&Pizza;
Reviews.Content: After my son and then my daughter bought this and were pretty content, I took the plunge into the smart phone world with this model. As it's my first smart phone, I have nothing to compare it with, but I can't say I have any complaints about how it serves me. I only use the Wi-Fi at home or in places like McDonalds, but it works well and considering it's free, the price is right. ;)  Also am loving the AirVoice service I use with this unlocked phone. For a moderate user like me, it's great. My son and I each spend only a few dollars a month for our respective phone bills. Incredible. And my daughter -- who texts a ton -- is coming in a just about $10/ month. Pantech Crossover paired with AirVoice -- great combo.

Reviews.Title: Pantech crossover p8000
Reviews.Author: Eddy
Reviews.Content: The phone is just what you would expect from a low end android device. So far the phone is working good using it within its capabilities. Battery life is good.UPDATE:The phone is still fully operational. You might not want to factory restore the phone since that makes it locked again, something I learned the hard way. Upgrading it to gingerbread 2.3 locks it also. After doing some online searching I acquired the unlock code so I upgraded to gingerbread. It runs even better now.

Reviews.Title: Great phone but....
Reviews.Author: acustomer
Reviews.Content: its a great phone but theres no flash for online streaming you tube work fine having no flash still bothers me though. take care

Reviews.Title: very good android
Reviews.Author: ilia tchabashvili
Reviews.Content: this phone are very good. nice battery , good picture, very very good google play , programs and other are very goood

Reviews.Title: Pantech P8000 Crossover
Reviews.Author: Keith Johnson "Livon"
Reviews.Content: This phone is great because my sister has one and she's been using it for over two years now and the phone still going pretty well of all its features. She's been texting and sending pictures messages downloading apps with this phone since the year 2010 when she purchased it and that is why I purchase one myself.  I give 5 stars of this item.

Reviews.Title: Too slow
Reviews.Author: preproc
Reviews.Content: The phone has good dimensions and weight for daily use and the keyboard feels decent,but the response time is really slow for a 600 MHz processor device which is one the very basic features nowadays.

Reviews.Title: excellent
Reviews.Author: NOEL N.
Reviews.Content: is nice product, simple and easy to setup. I buy 2 and I happy for this. I recommended more because is 100% unlocked

Reviews.Title: Good Value
Reviews.Author: S. Beckham
Reviews.Content: Just wanted a basic phone for a reasonable price.  This phone fits the bill.  It has been relatively easy to learn.What doesn't seem to be adequate is the loudness of the ringtone and the bluetooth volume.  Downloaded a free ap to get a louder ringtone.The bluetooth works better with some headsets than others.  By trial and error I've found some that work better than others.All in all a very good value.  Volume issues cost a star.

Reviews.Title: Its okay
Reviews.Author: Ramon ochoa
Reviews.Content: I'm happy with my phone but I must state that did not bring headphones or the cd with the software.The charging cable not working

Reviews.Title: echo in the phone
Reviews.Author: george w parker
Reviews.Content: this phone was one i got for my wife, no one could understand here because there was voice  echo no one could understand what she was saying

Reviews.Title: A phone for your mom
Reviews.Author: Amber Earley
Reviews.Content: My mom love this phone. The best part that she like about it is it has a keyboard. This phone is mom friendly.

Reviews.Title: works like it should
Reviews.Author: Fortyniene
Reviews.Content: Ok if you are looking for a phone because you lost or broke your phone and you can't get a new contract phone for 5 months and need a cheap phone to get you by until then this is the phone for you.Its pretty simple set up swap sim from old phone swap micro sd from old phone and bam you are reconnected to the world!I went 3 days without a phone when my xperia play decided it no longer wanted to turn on. This is no where near the high tech device that was but it was a cheap alternitive to the hundreds at&t; wanted for a new phone without a contract.It is at least a android so I can get the apps I was addicted to on my xperia play. And me and my wife are happy she did not like me not having a phoneOne last thing I am using this phone to write this review. I love amazon! Thanks for having everything a guy could need

Reviews.Title: Bought 3 of these after reading reviews and we were not disappointed
Reviews.Author: Robert Woock
Reviews.Content: So far we have ad these for about 5 days.  They work great right out the box.  We do not use any cellular data, so the house wifi works great.  My wife quickly figured out the wifi and setup e-mail on it.  My oldest daughter connected to facebook and downloaded all of her friends contacts.  Everyone likes the sliding keyboard and the on screen swype keyboard.Sound is good for calls.  Screen is small compared to most of todays androids, but that is not a problem for us. We will probably run the Android 2.3 upgrade in the future. but for now they work great.After playing with one for a while I did notice the slight scroll issue mentioned by some other reviewers. But it is not bad and is a very minor issue.  Did not occur all the time. Occasionally I had to press a little longer or harder to get a response.  But most of the time it is very quick to respond.  I found it's performance faster than I expected.Great value for the money.  I recommend these for anyone that is looking for the power of android and you do not mind the small screen for a great price.

Reviews.Title: Good Phone
Reviews.Author: Candice Shultheis
Reviews.Content: Phone is what was described. It was shipped on time and is what i expected it to be. its a good phone

Reviews.Title: Nice screen, good value
Reviews.Author: Big-Z
Reviews.Content: For a travel phone, this one is very nice. The problems have been pointed out by other reviewers: no SD card as indicated in the "what's in the box," that comes with the phone and the back cover is very difficult to attach... very fussy. Also upgrading to 2.3 android eliminates the unlocked feature, so add another $10 or more to buy the unlock code from a site on the internet. Pantech site is good and seems up-to-date. The screen is nice and clear and the design is very good. I have not used it yet for calls, since I bought it for a foreign trip in the late summer, but all the other features seem to work fine in my testing with a T-mobile pay-as-you-go sim card.

Reviews.Title: very good value/cost ratio
Reviews.Author: Julian
Reviews.Content: with a minimum price you got almost all the essential features of a Android phone: browsing, email, video, music, camera, skype, talktone, facebook..........., even GPS.performance is OK. touchscreen smoothly responsible.never played game. speak volume low, and not a good sound quality for music (OK with earphone).overall a very good value.

Reviews.Title: there was no sd card
Reviews.Author: Avery Whitt "C.W."
Reviews.Content: I was really excited for this phone because of all the good reviews but I've had some problems.I cannot seem to get the back to stay on. It keeps falling off. Although the actual phone is pretty good, it is kind of useless if the back is exposed with the battery continually falling out.Also, the phone did not contain an sd card so I cannot do much more than talk and text on it.I am somewhat disappointed and have gone back to using my old phone (Gravity 3) for now.EDIT: The back finally decided to stay on if I take a long tome to push it down but I have still not gotten a micro sd card for it so I cannot use many of the features including the camera, music player and sketch pad. The phone, however has grown on me.

Reviews.Title: Awesome startup Smart phone
Reviews.Author: Siva
Reviews.Content: For the cost, this is a great start up Smart phone. Of course there is a bit of lag while launching applications and it is not as smooth while browsing through images, but I expected that in this low end Smart phone. So no complaints.I love the horizontal "REAL" keyboard and use it a lot for messaging.

Reviews.Title: Nice Android Phone
Reviews.Author: Indiana conservative
Reviews.Content: It is a little soon to tell but so far it has lived up to my expectations. This is my first Android phone and I am still playing with all the functions. Seems a little difficult to find settings on it but use to Blackberry and Nokia E5 settings. Once I find them though I could kick myself for passing up the simplicity of the functions. Got the crossover because I thought I would need it just coming from using a functional key entry system for now.You can upgrade this phone from its 2.2 format to 2.3 Gingerbread rather easily if you have any tech abilities at all. Takes a little time but it can be done. I would recommend this phone to the beginner of the Android phone market. Oh yea I also use Straight Talk and it can be set up on this phone with a new sim card from Straight Talk if you like the pay as you go option.

Reviews.Title: Pantech P8000
Reviews.Author: Celo
Reviews.Content: Bought a couple of them for use outside of the US and my kids are extremely happy with the device. All the features works as expected. Battery life and connectivity are fair for their type of use.

Reviews.Title: Better than epected
Reviews.Author: Michael Martin
Reviews.Content: Being new to Smartphones I was supprised at how easy it was to set up etc. with my cell service.  It seems to work fine.

Reviews.Title: Pantech P8000
Reviews.Author: DAN ROD
Reviews.Content: it's cool but when i upgrade it, it are blocked. but I can buy the unlocking code for $1tHANKS!

Reviews.Title: Horrible Connection!!!
Reviews.Author: judith kahn
Reviews.Content: Cons-Don't Get it it always drops and has almost no connection!! Don't Let the price fool you!!!!Pros- It was cheap

Reviews.Title: Works good.......for about two weeks
Reviews.Author: griffen williams
Reviews.Content: This phone seems well contstructed until it starts powering down during your phone calls and then stops working altogether. DO NOT BUY THIS PHONE, IT WILL ONLY PISS YOU OFF!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: It's Ok
Reviews.Author: Mola
Reviews.Content: The phone is good. But I had to unlock it again before it will work. Why say its unlocked international phone when it will require buyer to spend additional money to unlock it? That's dishonesty.

Reviews.Title: Best phone I ever owned
Reviews.Author: Lia
Reviews.Content: This phone is the best phone I ever owned. Easy to use, durable, easy to see. It is everything it says it is, only better. I definitely recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: pantech 8000 crossover
Reviews.Author: blacksheep_steve
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best phone I have ever owned! It has a ton of features, yet is very user friendly! It also looks great and the battery holds a charge well.

Reviews.Title: i received it today
Reviews.Author: kelmon
Reviews.Content: it came new brand and package was in fairly good condition the phone came with charger,usb cable,battery and back cover user guide but my problems was the battery cover its really flimsy and kinda hard to go on and when you do get it on it looks as though it be easy to drop off but other wise dan that the phone its self is good,i just may buy i next one for my friend and see how it goes because my whom i bought this one for seems to like it its only the cover was a problem.

Reviews.Title: What is this?
Reviews.Author: Justin L.
Reviews.Content: I don't think I have anything good to say about this thing (not true, but close enough). Before I get into that I'd recommend the Samsung Flight I.Anyway first off this phone is very responsive which you'd think would be a good thing but the problem is its way to responsive whether its the touchscreen or the buttons you'll often find yourself pressing things you don't want to, mostly the search and back buttons since you barely have to touch them.Even the keyboard is too sensitive you'll press one key and more often than not it will also press one or two keys next to it. And one more thing about the touchscreen you can't use it at all if your wearing gloves.Another annoying thing is the screen will constantly be turning on you, you'll want it to be vertical and it will go horizontal and vice-versa.Maybe this is just my phone but it won't download any picture messages.The applications are all scattered around and its not worth your time rearranging them, to be completely honest I'm not sure if you can, a couple examples of it is you'd think your camera app and gallery app would be right next to each other but they're not the gallery is down a couple rows and one to the right. Also instead of having one convenient app for all of your tools your tools are also scattered, the alarm clock is the very first one then the calculator is one down and three to the right, and its basically like that for all the tools.And then I guess I do have a couple minor good things about this phone the internet is usually pretty fast, but again with the really sensitive touchscreen its still really annoying to use. I haven't tested it myself but it does seem like it could take a beating for a few years until it finally gets totaled. The quality of the camera is 3.0 Mega-Pixels, which I suppose is fair enough. And lastly the battery life is again fair enough, but like most phones if you use the internet too much it can drain the battery pretty quickly.Lastly one more minor thing about the phone is that the charger port is in an awkward spot, its on the right side of the phone which is the same way the phone slides so it can be kind've weird using it while its charging.Overall it could be a good phone if it wasn't so sensitive and everything wasn't scattered, but because of it, it just makes the phone close to unusable.

Reviews.Title: Great cheap phone

Reviews.Content: Bought it as a temporary phone, like it but it is slow. Too bad it's loaded with ATT bloatware.Great value for the price.

Reviews.Title: Best phone yet for the price
Reviews.Author: Donn G.Collins
Reviews.Content: I have had the phone for about two days. I have always been impressed with the Pantech products but this exceeded anything that I could imagine. It has the usual phone and texting but it does have so much more including internet, GPS (both driving and walking), Facebook, voice recognition, compass and the list goes on. The phone is light and the keyboard is the easiest one to use yet. I have just began preliminarily exploring the phone but to me it's cutting edge technology. I even have obtained, from Amazon, a leather case and a window mounting at a fraction of the retail price. To sum it up "it's a great deal".

Reviews.Title: Not even worth the cheap price
Reviews.Author: R. M. Swope
Reviews.Content: I don't review items often. They usually either have to be extremely good or extremely bad for me to review them. If it falls between those categories, I usually don't bother. Unfortunately for me, this was one that fell under the "extremely bad" category. A week after I bought this I would have easily given it a 4/5 star, with the star missing because of it being quite slow (even for the outdated processor). However after 3 months of owning this, I'm realizing how horrible of a device this really is. I bought this knowing it was outdated, and I take this into consideration with my review, but there are just too many negatives to give this a positive review whatsoever. This was only meant to be a 3-4 month replacement phone until I'm eligible for my new upgrade, but I'll be lucky to make it a few more weeks without using this thing as target practice.The Good:-Durable-Slide-out keyboard-I like the design-Decent battery-AffordableThe Bad:-Horribly slow, sometimes to the point of me sitting the phone down, and grabbing a snack or drink until it loads something as simple as my contacts page-The lock/power button is at a really dumb spot when trying to use the slide-out keyboard. I frequently lock (stand-by) my phone while texting-When using the touchscreen keyboard in portrait mode, for some reason it has virtually no ability to predict any text. What's worse is that it not only can't predict it, but it will try to change the most common of words into other words you don't want. It just doesn't have the common words in it's "word bank" so to speak. I literally had to add words like it, in, then (and multiple more).The Ugly:-Randomly shuts off quite frequently. Sometimes it will do it one time in 2 weeks, the next time it shut off 3 times in one day.-Almost every day now, I lose touch screen functionality in the upper half of the screen (in other words anything you try to press on in the top 50% of the screen will not respond). This makes the phone nearly useless.I seem to have the worst luck with phones. I've only had one half-decent phone out of my last 5 phones (and that one took a dive on the highway because I accidentally left it on the hood of my car), and this phone is BY FAR the worst one I have had.

Reviews.Title: Decent phone, but you get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: Hoosteen
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone looking for a, inexpensive Android device. Indeed, it was inexpensive, with a refurb for only $70.What I liked:-Good battery life. Didn't die until after several days of light usage.-Good call quality.-Very solid, rugged feel.-QWERTY keyboard buttons, though flat, have a good feel to them and were pretty intuitive.What I didn't like:-This thing is hefty.-Sluggish performance. Live wallpapers and downloading apps cause massive slowdown. I tried streaming Netflix to this device and found it to be too much of a pain due to its low frame rate.-Unresponsive screen. You'll require several swipes to get through the different home screens. The unresponsive screen, combined with the sluggish performance, make menial tasks such as scrolling through menus a pain.This phone is meant to for those who are crossing over from feature phones to smartphones, but I fear that its slow performance and poor screen response would scare off this demographic. For better-performing devices with the same price range, I would recommend the LG P500 and the Google Nexus One.

Reviews.Title: Beware of the seller!! Great phone, if the phone service wasnt disabled...
Reviews.Author: Tyler Kerkela
Reviews.Content: There are a lot of great reviews on this phone so I decided to purchase it. Got the phone within a couple of days which was nice as I was so excited to finally get a new phone. Opened up the huge box to find that you could fit about 4-6 phone boxes within this box with absolutely no padding, which scared me. Charged the battery, put my AT&T; SIM card in and I thought I was good to go. Was I wrong!! I had absolutely no service at all with this phone. The phone said service unavailable, but everything else worked great. Very frustrated, I went to my local AT&T; store and they looked at the phone and tried everything they could to get the service back to the phone. They even swapped my SIM card to multiple phones in the store and all the other phones worked fine. They said the term that "This phone must be flashed or something because everything works fine but the service". After driving nearly 80 miles round trip to find out that this phone is junk I immediately packed the phone back up and sent it back. Never again will I try buying an electronic device on Amazon. Nothing against Amazon, just mainly the seller. I would rather get the phone locally so I know it actually works. Beware of the seller because now after I bought and returned this phone the seller has changed. Seemed like a great phone, but what use is a phone with the service disabled.

I DO NOT recommend this phone. I have had a lot of phones but this is the biggest piece of junk I have ever bought. What a total waste of money. I am now on my third return in a little over a week and i will not be getting another.

Reviews.Title: Fun phone! but not AT&T;
Reviews.Author: Nor Cal
Reviews.Content: My teenage son loved the phone but at&t; won't let you use it without a data package. He does'nt need the internet on his phone. They automatically, without asking, put on a $30 a month data plan. When I contacted them they said (Oh we can lower it to a $20 a month plan) which is $240 a year!  We had the wi fi and internet access turned off. We asked them if they could block it,they said yes but they would'nt. We have 4 services bundled with at&t;  and they would not compromise. Maybe we should rethink that. Just seems like they're trying to force us into more and more expensive services. They suggested I return the phone and go with a non smart phone. This is not a high tec phone.
